0.title: Angad Bedi, Kirti Kulhari to reunite after 6 years for 'The List'
0.article_body: Actors Angad Bedi and Kirti Kulhari are teaming up again, after the 2016 movie 'Pink', for a short film titled 'The List'. It's a futuristic drama which is directed by Gaurav Dave. Speaking about the film, Angad said, "The film is...a commentary on how robotic our...lives have become and Gaurav truly believed...Kirti and I'd be able to manifest this on-screen."

1.title: You are the motivation of young India: Saaina to PM Modi on his 72nd birthday
1.article_body: Indian shuttler Saaina Nehwal took to Twitter on PM Narendra Modi's 72nd birthday and wrote, "May God give you good health and long life. You are the motivation of young India and the role model of every ordinary person." CWG 2022 gold medal-winning weightlifter Mirabai Chanu tweeted, "Wishing you a long and healthy life in the service of the nation."

2.title: Delhi recorded this year's first 'good' air quality day on Friday
2.article_body: Delhi recorded this year's first 'good' air quality day on Friday with AQI of 47. AQI till 50 is considered 'good', while AQI of 51 to 100 is classified as 'satisfactory' which could lead to "minor breathing discomfort to sensitive people", as per the Central Pollution Control Board. Delhi recorded only one day of good air quality last year.

3.title: Federer to get warm farewell at Swiss Indoors Basel: Tournament Prez Brennwald
3.article_body: Swiss Roger Federer will be given a "warm farewell" in St Jakobshalle, said President of Swiss Indoors Basel ATP 500 tournament Roger Brennwald. "Further information will follow at a later date," he added. Federer has won a record 10 singles titles in Basel. The 20-time Grand Slam champion will be retiring after next week's Laver Cup.

4.title: 3 injured after SUV rams into vehicle carrying iron rods in NCR
4.article_body: Three people were seriously injured after an SUV rammed into a tractor-trolley, carrying iron rods, from behind on the Delhi-Gurugram national highway on Saturday, police said. The iron rods protruding from the tractor-trolley pierced through the SUV, injuring three of its five occupants, as per an eyewitness. The rods pierced through the neck of the car's driver, the eyewitness added.

5.title: More AAP MLAs will be arrested: Kejriwal after Amanatullah's arrest
5.article_body: Delhi CM and AAP chief Arvind Kejriwal on Saturday said that following the arrest of Amanatullah Khan, several other AAP MLAs will face arrest in the coming days. "It seems they (BJP) are hurt badly in Gujarat," Kejriwal added. AAP MLA Amanatullah Khan was arrested on Friday by Delhi Anti-Corruption Branch in a case linked to the Delhi Waqf Board.

6.title: TN BJP to gift ₹5,000 gold rings to newborns on PM Modi's birthday
6.article_body: BJP's Tamil Nadu unit has planned to gift gold rings to newborns at a government hospital in Chennai on PM Narendra Modi's birthday. "All children born [at RSRM hospital] on [PM's] birthday will be given a...ring," minister L Murugan said. He estimated that each ring will cost approximately ₹5,000. The party expects about 10-15 deliveries at the hospital today (Saturday).

7.title: NDMC to revamp 41 roads ahead of India's G-20 presidency
7.article_body: Before India assumes the presidency of G-20 this December, the New Delhi Municipal Council (NDMC) will revamp 41 roads and major traffic circles in the city at a cost of ₹85 crore. The municipality has set a deadline of four months to finish the work. During India's G-20 presidency, 12,000 delegates will visit the capital, officials said.

8.title: Congo Prez's top aide caught demanding bribe on tape, resigns
8.article_body: A top adviser of Congolese President Felix Tshisekedi resigned on Friday after he was allegedly caught on tape negotiating kickbacks on a mineral deal. Media organisation Organised Crime and Corruption Reporting Project said Vidiye Tshimanga was recorded negotiating his "percentage" for the deal by two individuals posing as mineral investors. Tshimanga has refuted the allegations against himself.

9.title: Ranvir Shorey’s father, filmmaker Krishan Dev Shorey, passes away at 92
9.article_body: Actor Ranvir Shorey’s father, filmmaker Krishan Dev Shorey, passed away aged 92 on Friday night. Ranvir took to Instagram to condole his father’s death, and called him his "greatest source of inspiration and protection". KD Shorey produced several films in the 1980s and 1990s under his banner KDS Films.

10.title: Pune municipal schools facing shortage of teachers: NCP leader
10.article_body: Nationalist Congress Party (NCP) leader Nitin Kadam said there is a shortage of English-medium teachers in schools under Pune Municipal Corporation. He said many parents lost their income source during the COVID-19 pandemic and so many children were transferred to municipal schools from private English ones. Kadam said there is a shortage of teachers for these new students.

11.title: PMPML criticised for cutting e-bus fleet in Pune for ops in Satara
11.article_body: The Pune Mahanagar Parivahan Mahamandal Limited (PMPML) has been criticised for providing its e-buses to serve tourists at 'Kas Pathar' in Satara district. Activists said Pune needs more e-buses and that Maharashtra State Road Transport Corporation should provide buses for 'Kas Pathar'. As per plans, the PMPML will initially provide five e-buses for the 'Kas Pathar' tourist site.

12.title: Ayushmann's 'Dream Girl 2' to clash with Kartik's 'Satyaprem...' in June 2023
12.article_body: Ayushmann Khurrana's 'Dream Girl 2' is set to clash with Kartik Aaryan and Kiara Advani-starrer 'Satyaprem Ki Katha' next year. Both films are slated to release in theatres on June 29. Directed by Raaj Shaandilyaa, 'Dream Girl 2' will also feature Ananya Panday and Paresh Rawal among others in pivotal roles. 'Satyaprem Ki Katha' is being directed by Sameer Vidwans.

13.title: T'gana CM KCR inaugurates Adivasi Bhavan, Banjara bhavan in Hyderabad
13.article_body: Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao on Saturday inaugurated Komaram Bheem Adivasi Bhavan and Sevalal Banjara building in Hyderabad. "The mere inauguration of these buildings won't...transform the situation of what they went through. There's still a long way to go in that direction," KCR said. These buildings will serve as platforms to discuss issues of both the communities, he added.

14.title: Frontline bank staff should be well-versed in local languages: FM
14.article_body: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said that it is important to have staff who are well-versed in local languages at banks. "We cannot have staff who don't speak the local language and...demand from citizens that they speak in a particular language," she said, adding that banks need to look at language skills of the staff posted at branch levels.

15.title: Russian troops setting up new defensive line in northeast Ukraine: UK
15.article_body: UK's Defence Ministry said Russian troops were working on establishing a new defensive line in Ukraine's northeast. The line likely is between the Oskil River and the town of Svatove, some 150 kilometres southeast of Ukraine's second-largest city Kharkiv, it added. This comes as a counteroffensive operation saw Ukrainian forces recapture large parts of land in the northeastern Kharkiv region.

16.title: Ocean farming startup Sea6 Energy raises $18.5 mn in Series B round
16.article_body: Ocean farming startup Sea6 Energy has raised $18.5 million in a Series B funding round from investors such as BASF Venture Capital and Aqua-Spark. The Bengaluru-headquartered startup produces and processes tropical red seaweed. It also aims to reduce India's dependency on imported oil by replacing fossil fuels with biofuels. It has also converted seaweed into bio-stimulants.

17.title: BMC soon to take over maintenance of 2 major roads of Mumbai
17.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) will take over the maintenance of Mumbai's two roads, namely the Western and Eastern Express Highways. The BMC Commissioner Iqbal Singh Chahal said that the handover decision from the Mumbai Metropolitan Region Development Authority (MMRDA) to the civic body was taken on September 16 at a meeting headed by CM Eknath Shinde.

18.title: Adani becomes 2nd largest cement firm after Ambuja, ACC acquisition
18.article_body: With the completion of the acquisition of Ambuja Cements and ACC, Adani Group has now become the country's second-largest cement player. Holcim sold its entire stake in Ambuja Cements at ₹385 apiece and in ACC at ₹2,300 apiece. Adani Group Chairperson Gautam Adani tweeted about the development and said, "We will double our capacity in the next five years."

19.title: IIT Guwahati student dies by suicide in hostel room, probe underway
19.article_body: A student from IIT Guwahati allegedly died by suicide in his hostel room on Friday night, officials said. The deceased, identified as Surya Narayan Premkishore, was a final-year undergraduate student and hailed from Kerala, reports said. Police have started an investigation after registering a case of unnatural death. According to reports, the reason behind the step is not yet known.

20.title: Pakistan 'super floods' impacted 16 million children: UNICEF
20.article_body: An estimated 16 million children have been impacted by "super floods" in Pakistan, UNICEF said. "Young children are living out in the open with their families, with no drinking water, no food and no livelihood, exposed to a wide range of new flood-related risks and hazards, from damaged buildings, drowning in flood waters and snakes," UNICEF representative Abdullah Fadil said.

21.title: Banking has biggest role to make India developed nation by 2047: FM
21.article_body: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said that trajectory of Indian Banks' Association (IBA) is aligned with free India's trajectory. She stated, "The biggest role to make India a developed country by 2047 is of the banking sector." "I have a sense of gratitude for banks...You have gone through the test of fire," she added, appreciating their work during the COVID-19 pandemic.

22.title: Man helps wife deliver baby on highway, uses phone chargers to tie umbilical cord in US
22.article_body: A couple recently delivered their daughter on the side of a highway in US, with the woman saying that her husband used two phone chargers to tie off the umbilical cord. She revealed they were on their way to a hospital when she realised she wasn't going to make it on time. Both the mother and baby are healthy.

23.title: 4 killed, 8 injured as SUV collides head-on with truck in Chittorgarh
23.article_body: Four people died and eight others were injured after an SUV collided head-on with a truck in Rajasthan's Chittorgarh district on Friday. The accident occurred while the occupants of the SUV were returning from Udaipur to Indore after attending the last rites of a relative, according to police. The injured were referred from Mangalwad to Udaipur after primary treatment.

24.title: Dalai Lama wishes PM on his birthday, praises India's fight against COVID-19
24.article_body: Tibetan spiritual leader Dalai Lama wished Prime Minister Narendra Modi on his 72nd birthday and praised India for its fight against COVID-19. "It's wonderful that India has successfully met the challenges posed by the coronavirus pandemic. Although we have not seen the complete end of it, India today is better placed to address similar challenges in the future," he said.

25.title: So happy & proud: Kriti's mother pens note after actress wins Filmfare award
25.article_body: Actress Kriti Sanon's mother Geeta Sanon took to Instagram and congratulated her daughter for bagging the Best Actress award at the 67th Filmfare Awards. "Distance couldn't stop us from sharing...happy moment of having another black lady in your hand," she wrote, adding, "I'm so happy and proud, my girl. Surely many more of such glorious moments will come your way."

26.title: Youth responsible for strengthening democratic institutions: Om Birla
26.article_body: Talking about the role of youth in nation building, Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla said that the younger generation is responsible for bolstering democratic institutions across the country. "New innovations in the world are taking us on the path of prosperity...The youth, as future nation builders, must understand the process and procedure of legislation," said Birla.

27.title: Police seize drug peddler's properties worth ₹1.60 crore in Bengaluru
27.article_body: Karnataka City Central Crime Branch on Saturday seized properties worth ₹1.60 crore belonging to a drug peddler in Bengaluru. Police said Mrutyunjaya alias Jayanna had purchased movable and immovable assets through the money minted in the drug peddling nexus. He was arrested in July and ₹80 lakh worth of hashish oil and ganja had been seized.

28.title: 19-yr-old gets life imprisonment for murdering man in 2019 in Rajasthan
28.article_body: A POCSO court in Rajasthan's Kota has awarded a life term to a 19-year-old youth for murdering a man here three years ago. The convict was 16 years old when he murdered a 21-year-old fellow villager in March 2019 over suspicion of a love affair with his sister. The youth had dumped the victim's body near a pond.

29.title: US Prez Biden meets families of Americans jailed in Russia
29.article_body: US President Joe Biden on Friday met the families of two Americans, Brittney Griner and Paul Whelan, detained in Russia. Biden reassured them that he was working to bring Griner and Whelan back home. Basketball player Brittney Griner is currently serving a nine-year prison sentence on drug charges, while ex-US Marine Whelan is serving a 16-year sentence on espionage-related charges.

30.title: Ex-Union Minister & Congress leader Manikrao Gavit dies at 87 in Nashik
30.article_body: Manikrao Gavit, former Union Minister and Congress MP, passed away at the age of 87 on Saturday. He had been ill for some time and died in a hospital in Maharashtra's Nashik. A nine-time Lok Sabha MP, Gavit represented the tribal-dominated Nandurbar constituency between 1980 and 2009. He also served as Minister of State for Social Justice during UPA government.

31.title: PM Modi recalls visiting his mother on birthdays, says 'I couldn't go this time'
31.article_body: PM Modi, while addressing an event of women's self-help groups, recalled birthday visits to his mother Heeraben Modi. "Usually, on this day, I try to visit my mother, touch her feet and take her blessings. But today, I could not go...But lakhs of women in Madhya Pradesh are giving me their blessings," said PM Modi.

32.title: No. 4 is good for me: Suryakumar on his preferred batting position
32.article_body: Talking about his preferred batting position, Team India batter Suryakumar Yadav said he has loved batting at every spot but the number four is a good position for him. "The situation that I go into bat allows me to control the game. I have enjoyed myself most when I bat between overs seven and 15," he added.

33.title: Automobile offender arrested in Hyd, two-wheelers worth ₹10 lakh seized
33.article_body: Hyderabad's Chilkalguda police arrested one automobile offender, identified as 24-year-old Thumma Adithya, and recovered two-wheelers worth ₹10 lakh from him. The accused was a resident of Hyderabad's Musheerabad, police stated. The police began investigation after receiving a complaint from Shaik Abdul Kaleem, who stated that his two-wheeler went missing near Jamia Osmania on September 11.

34.title: Congo national held for trying to smuggle 1.5 kg cocaine in Mumbai
34.article_body: The Directorate of Revenue Intelligence arrested a 50-year-old Congo national, identified as Alfa Tsouke, for allegedly trying to smuggle 1.5 kg of cocaine stuffed in 115 pallets concealed inside his body in Mumbai. According to the DRI officials, Tsouke was detained 11 days ago from the Mumbai international airport. After questioning, the accused was admitted to JJ Hospital, officials said.

35.title: Gyanvapi mosque case could go the Babri Masjid way: Owaisi
35.article_body: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi said the Varanasi court's order on Gyanvapi mosque has opened the door for endless litigation. The court dismissed a plea against Hindu women seeking to worship inside Gyanvapi. "If this litigation continues, it will go on the path of the Babri Masjid case. It appears we are going back to the 1980s and 1990s," said Owaisi.

36.title: Portable fingerprint scanner finds 3,294 criminal records matches in K'taka
36.article_body: The Automated Fingerprint Identification System linked to a portable fingerprint scanner in Karnataka has checked 93,645 fingerprints over the last year-and-a-half. The system has found 3,294 matches with criminal records, reports said. "There are over 2 lakh fingerprints of persons involved in property crimes in the database," an official said.

37.title: Jamia Millia Islamia bans Safoora Zargar from entering university campus
37.article_body: Jamia Millia Islamia has banned activist Safoora Zargar from entering the university campus. "It has been observed that Ms Safoora Zargar (ex-student) has been involved in organising agitations...against the irrelevant (issues)...to disturb the peaceful academic environment with few students who are mostly outsiders," the order states. Notably, this comes after her MPhil admission was cancelled.

38.title: Partha Chatterjee sent to CBI custody till September 21 in SSC scam
38.article_body: A court sent suspended TMC leader and former West Bengal Education Minister Partha Chatterjee to CBI custody till September 21 in connection with the School Service Commission appointments scam case. "The magnitude of the crime is huge. More things are yet to be clarified...in order to get a transparent probe we demanded CBI custody for Chatterjee," the CBI lawyer said.

39.title: Neena lived on her own terms & made society accept her: Satish Kaushik
39.article_body: Actor-filmmaker Satish Kaushik, who has teamed up with Neena Gupta for his next directorial 'Kaagaz 2', has said the actress "stood for herself in a society which did not accept a lot of things back then". He added that she lived on her own terms and made society accept her. "That's something I've always admired in her," said Satish.

40.title: 5 bike-borne men open fire on labour contractor in Thane
40.article_body: Five-bike borne men opened fire on a labour contractor, identified as Ganesh Kokate, in Thane in the early hours of Saturday, police said. Kokate was travelling in his car, when the accused shot at the vehicle at point-blank range, senior inspector Sulabha Patil said, adding Kokate did not sustain any injuries. The five accused escaped from the scene, she added.

41.title: 5 of family, including 2 kids, killed in car-truck collision near Ahmedabad
41.article_body: A family of five, including two children aged one and ten, died in a collision on the Dhandhuka-Bagodara highway on the outskirts of Ahmedabad on Friday night. According to police, the incident occurred when the truck was going towards Bagodara, while the car was coming from the opposite direction. "An FIR was lodged...and we've detained the driver," an official said.

42.title: Bodies' limbs broken, some had ropes around necks: Ukraine Prez as 440 bodies found
42.article_body: After a mass burial site with over 440 bodies was found in Izium, that was recaptured from Russian forces by Ukraine, the country's President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said some of the dead were tortured with ropes around their necks and broken limbs. Several bodies had their hands tied behind their backs. Zelenskyy called it a "proof of war crime by invader".

43.title: My time with coaching has come to an end: Ravi Shastri
43.article_body: Ex-India head coach Ravi Shastri suggested he won't take up coaching jobs. "My time with coaching has come to an end. For seven years, I've done enough." He added, "If I'm doing some coaching, it'll be at the grassroots level, for which I have a company that is doing it...Now I'll view the game from far away and enjoy it."

44.title: Why will stars do my film when they get ₹50 cr for 1 gutkha ad: Prakash Jha
44.article_body: Filmmaker Prakash Jha in an interview spoke about his previous remark that he struggles to cast stars in his projects. He said, "Why will they work in my films when they get ₹50 crore for doing one gutkha advertisement?" "When stars take time out from selling gutkhas and want to focus on content, they will come to me," Prakash added.

45.title: Dutch town sues Twitter over 'satanic' paedophile conspiracy theories
45.article_body: A Dutch town has taken Twitter to court over the spread of a conspiracy theory claiming it was once home to a ring of 'Satan-worshipping paedophiles'. Reports claiming Bodegraven-Reeuwijk was the site of abuse of multiple children in the 1980s were first circulated by three men in 2020. The main instigator said he'd witnessed the crimes as a child.

46.title: PM Modi shares new pictures after releasing cheetahs in national park
46.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi took to Twitter to share new pictures after releasing cheetahs in Madhya Pradesh's Kuno National Park. He wrote, "A long wait is over, the Cheetahs have a home in India at the Kuno National Park." As many as eight cheetahs have been brought from Namibia to reintroduce the species in India after 70 years.

47.title: India trail Norway 0-2 after 1st day of Davis Cup World Group I tie
47.article_body: Indian tennis team trailed hosts Norway 0-2 at the end of the first day of Davis Cup World Group I tie in Lillehammer on Friday. In first match, Prajnesh Gunneswaran lost to world number two Casper Ruud 1-6, 4-6. Ramkumar Ramanathan, India's highest-ranked men's singles player at 276, lost to world number 325 Viktor Durasovic 1-6, 4-6 in second match.

48.title: TRS leader's car vandalised as it blocks Amit Shah's convoy in Hyd: Report
48.article_body: TRS leader Gosula Srinivas' car was reportedly vandalised after it blocked Home Minister Amit Shah's convoy in Hyderabad on Saturday. The car was found parked at a hotel's door when Shah's convoy came near the hotel, reports said. "The car stopped just like that. I was in tension. I will speak to [police officers]. They vandalised the car," Srinivas said.

49.title: Iran Prez orders probe after woman dies in 'morality police' custody
49.article_body: Iranian President Ebrahim Raisi has ordered an investigation into the death of a 22-year-old-woman who died days after being arrested by the country's "morality police". Mahsa Amini was reportedly arrested on Tuesday over 'improper hijab'. Police have denied allegations that Amini was physically abused and said that she was taken to a hospital after she suffered a heart attack.

50.title: Take a day off and enjoy your birthday, sir: SRK to PM Modi on his 72nd birthday
50.article_body: Wishing Prime Minister Narendra Modi on his 72nd birthday, actor Shah Rukh Khan tweeted, "Your dedication for the welfare of our country and its people is highly appreciated." He added, "May you have the strength and health to achieve all your goals. Take a day off and enjoy your birthday, sir. Happy Birthday."

51.title: Salesman arrested for printing fake Indian currency notes in Mumbai
51.article_body: A 22-year-old salesman was arrested for allegedly printing fake Indian currency notes worth lakhs in Mumbai. The accused, Rohit Shah, used to print fake Indian currency notes of ₹200, ₹100 and ₹50 from a house in Mankhurd, police said. Notably, the police seized several items, including equipment used in printing fake currency, during the raid at the house.

52.title: Google accidentally pays ₹2 crore to US hacker, says 'we're working to correct it'
52.article_body: Google has confirmed that it accidentally paid an American hacker $250,000 (nearly ₹2 crore) after he tweeted about receiving the money in his account. "It's been a little over 3 weeks since Google randomly sent me $249,999 and I still haven't heard anything," Sam Curry had tweeted. Putting the blame on "human error", Google said it's working to correct it.

53.title: Divisive forces using National Integration Day for their 'selfish politics': KCR
53.article_body: On the occasion of Telangana National Integration Day, CM KCR said that divisive forces are using the occasion for their "narrow and selfish politics". He also asked people to make sure that the state doesn’t go down the rabbit hole of hatred. He added that the struggle, strategies, and sacrifices made by the people are well known.

54.title: I don't think fielding is crucial in T20 cricket: Sanjay Manjrekar
54.article_body: Ex-India batter Sanjay Manjrekar said he doesn't think fielding is crucial in T20 cricket. "If somebody has got brilliant skills in batting and bowling, then maybe fielding can be ignored," added Manjrekar. Manjrekar made these remarks after being asked for his opinion on whether all-rounder Ravichandran Ashwin fits into Team India's T20 World Cup 2022 squad considering his fielding.

55.title: World’s biggest Ethereum mining firm shuts down servers after Merge
55.article_body: Ethermine, the largest Ethereum mining services provider by computing power, shut down its servers after Ethereum shifted from proof-of-work system to proof-of-stake on Thursday. The shift called the Merge doesn't allow miners to use graphic cards to validate transactions. Ethermine said that a few days after the Merge it'll trigger an automatic payout to its miners for any unpaid balances.

56.title: Slogans raised in Hyd before T'gana Home Minister to release Raja Singh
56.article_body: Supporters of jailed BJP MLA Raja Singh on Friday demanded his release by raising slogans at a function hall in Hyderabad in front of Telangana Home Minister Mohammed Mahmood Ali. They denounced the invoking of Preventive Detention Act against Singh and raised slogans against the Telangana government. TRS workers raised counter slogans. Police pushed the protesters out of the hall.

57.title: 14-yr-old girl sold by mother's partner for ₹3 lakh, raped in Raj
57.article_body: A zero FIR was filed after a 14-year-old girl from Rajasthan's Dholpur was allegedly sold for ₹3 lakh by her mother's live-in partner to a man, who then reportedly illegally married her and raped her, police said. The incident came to light after the girl managed to escape and reach Jaipur, where she was found by Bachpan Bachao Andolan members.

58.title: Gujarat CM launches world’s largest blood donation drive on PM’s birthday
58.article_body: On the occasion of PM Modi's 72nd birthday, Gujarat CM Bhupendra Patel launched the world's largest blood donation drive in Ahmedabad. He congratulated the organisers and said, "Such a big event for blood donation has been organised for the first time. PM Modi has always given priority to the works of service."

59.title: 'Project Cheetah' govt's attempt to preserve environment, wildlife: PM Modi
59.article_body: PM Narendra Modi said 'Project Cheetah', under which Centre reintroduced cheetahs in the country, is government's endeavour towards wildlife and environment conservation. "Today the cheetah has returned to the soil of India. Along with these cheetahs, the nature-loving consciousness of India has also been awakened," he added. The cheetahs were introduced in MP's Kuno National Park on Saturday.

60.title: 50-year-old man who murdered intoxicated man in Delhi 25 years ago held
60.article_body: The Delhi Police have arrested a 50-year-old man for allegedly murdering another man 25 years ago. Reports said that the accused, Ramu, murdered the victim, Kishan Lal, at a party when the latter was intoxicated. Lal's wife helped the police in tracing Ramu's family and later also helped identify Ramu, police said.

61.title: India's forex reserves drop to $550 bn, lowest in nearly 2 years
61.article_body: India's foreign exchange reserves fell to their lowest level in nearly two years, the Reserve Bank of India data showed. The reserves fell by $2.234 billion to $550.87 billion as of September 9. This is the sixth weekly fall in the country's forex reserves, which have declined by almost $80 billion since the start of the Russia-Ukraine war in February.

62.title: Guj bus catches fire after malfunction in system, 15-20 passengers evacuated
62.article_body: A bus caught fire after a reported malfunction in the system in Gujarat's Ahmedabad, reports said. "Initially there was smoke, which the driver smelled. But there was no BRTS station nearby when the smoke was sensed by the bus driver," an official said, adding that there were about 15 to 20 passengers in the bus. The passengers were evacuated.

63.title: Pune-based group to stage protest over ban on cyclists at SPPU
63.article_body: A Pune-based non-profit organisation, Indo Athletic Society, will stage a protest at the main gate of Savitribai Phule Pune University (SPPU) against a ban on cyclists on campus on Saturday. The group's head said that the ban has been in place since a month and added, "We question this unfairness towards cyclists while two- and four-wheelers are allowed on...campus."

64.title: India's growth to be sustained in months ahead: Finance Ministry report
64.article_body: Amid a revival in employment numbers and a rebound in private consumption, India's economic growth is likely to be sustained in the coming months, Finance Ministry's Department of Economic Affairs report said. Inflationary pressures are also likely to subside with easing of external pressure. Real GDP in Q1 FY23 is nearly 4% ahead of its corresponding 2019-20 level, it added.

65.title: MobiKwik appoints Mukul Saxena as CEO for payment gateway Zaakpay
65.article_body: Sequoia Capital-backed MobiKwik has named Mukul Saxena as the CEO of its financial services and payment gateway platform Zaakpay. Saxena, who has over 20-year experience in the business, formerly served as Executive Vice President and Director of IndusInd Bank's payments department. MobiKwik was founded by Bipin Preet Singh and Upasana Taku in 2009 and became a unicorn in October 2021.

66.title: Don't rename AIIMS Delhi: Faculty body writes to Health Minister
66.article_body: The Faculty Association of AIIMS (FAIMS) has written a letter to Union Health Minister Mansukh Mandaviya urging him to not change the name of AIIMS Delhi. The association said it would lead to a loss of the institute's identity. "That is why famous and established institutes have the same names for centuries - Oxford, Cambridge and Harvard universities," it said.

67.title: Figma founder, who's a college dropout, to get $2 billion after selling startup to Adobe
67.article_body: Figma founder Dylan Field's stake in the online design startup will be valued at more than $2 billion after its $20-billion sale to Adobe. Field dropped out of an Ivy League school in 2012 to accept a $100,000 grant from billionaire Peter Thiel to start Figma. With this, Field has also become the wealthiest person to go through Thiel Fellowship.

68.title: IFS officer's Twitter thread on what led to extinction of cheetahs in India goes viral
68.article_body: With India reintroducing cheetahs after declaring the species extinct domestically over 70 years ago, IFS officer Parveen Kaswan's Twitter thread on what led to their extinction went viral. Sharing archival footage, Kaswan explained how cheetahs were domesticated and used by hunting parties. He also shared a picture, showing "last lot" of cheetahs being hunted by King of Koriya in 1947.

69.title: I thought I was God, loved women too much: Ex-Madrid player Royston
69.article_body: Discussing his failure at Real Madrid, the club's ex-footballer Royston Drenthe said, "I wasn't ready to be a pro. I thought I was God, loved women and...partying too much and you can't combine that with football." "When you are 20 years old and nobody has ever taught you how to act, it becomes difficult to learn," added Royston.

70.title: 292 cases against Ola, Uber in Bengaluru over charging high fares: Report
70.article_body: The Karnataka Transport Department has filed 292 cases against Ola, Uber and other such companies for charging high fares in Bengaluru, reports said. Reports added that several commuters had made complaints about the same. Some commuters had also sent their complaints via email to state Chief Minister Basavaraj Bommai and other top officials.

71.title: Musk demands testimony of Twitter's ex-product chief in takeover dispute
71.article_body: Elon Musk has demanded Twitter make Kayvon Beykpour, the firm's ex-head of consumer unit, testify about spam accounts in $44 billion Twitter takeover dispute. Beykpour's lawyers recently said he's "beyond the subpoena power" of US courts as he's currently outside US. However, Musk's legal team in a filing said, "Beykpour is within Twitter's control and [it] must produce...[him] for deposition."

72.title: 'Tamasha' orchestrated by PM: Congress on return of cheetahs
72.article_body: In a bid to assert that the "cheetah project" began during UPA years, Congress leader and former Union Minister Jairam Ramesh shared a picture from his 2010 South Africa visit, showing him with a cheetah. "The 'tamasha' orchestrated by PM [Narendra Modi] today is unwarranted and is yet another diversion from pressing national issues," he said after cheetahs reached India.

73.title: Upset over a dish that her mom made for dinner, Dehradun girl kills self
73.article_body: A 16-year-old girl allegedly died by suicide after having an argument with her mother over a dish prepared for dinner in Dehradun. The girl reportedly expressed displeasure over the dish cooked by her mother and refused to have dinner. She then locked herself in her room. Family members broke the door open when she did not respond after some time.

74.title: Denmark's ex-spy chief charged with leaking 'highly classified' info
74.article_body: Denmark's former foreign intelligence chief was formally charged on Friday with leaking "highly classified information". Lars Findsen, who was in the post from 2015 until his abrupt suspension in 2020, is accused of passing state secrets to six people including two journalists. Findsen was held in custody from December 2021 to February 2022 while under investigation.

75.title: Coordination between Rohit, Dravid in front of media important: Ajay Jadeja
75.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Ajay Jadeja said it's important for India captain Rohit Sharma and head coach Rahul Dravid to have "coordination" in front of media. "There shouldn't be...confusion over team combinations. There shouldn't be statements about 'trying out things'...These are players and they have families," added Ajay. "When they read them, such things do pop up at a certain...time," he stated.

76.title: Harbinger of achhe din: Anil, Kangana wish PM Modi on his birthday
76.article_body: Bollywood celebrities like Anil Kapoor, Kangana Ranaut and Akshay Kumar took to social media to wish Prime Minister Narendra Modi on his birthday. Anil tweeted, "A very Happy Birthday to the man who...put India on the world map...The harbinger of achhe din." Kangana wrote, "From selling tea...as a child to becoming the most powerful man on...planet...Nothing can erase your legacy."

77.title: Gujarat is no Pakistan: Fadnavis on Maharashtra losing Vedanta project
77.article_body: After Gujarat bagged the Vedanta-Foxconn project, Maharashtra Deputy CM Devendra Fadnavis said the neighbouring state was "no Pakistan". "It's our brother," Fadnavis added. He further criticised the previous Uddhav Thackeray-led government for losing the deal, claiming 10% commission had to be paid for availing of any subsidy when MVA government was in power but Gujarat surged ahead at that time.

78.title: Statement was provocative: Ramiz Raja on video of him grabbing Indian reporter's phone
78.article_body: Reacting to a video that showed him getting angry at an Indian reporter and grabbing his phone after Pakistan's loss at Asia Cup final, PCB chief Ramiz Raja said the reporter's statement was "provocative". "The reporter said all Pakistani fans are angry with the loss...I just asked him how he'd know that. You're staying in a different area," Raja added.

79.title: UP appoints retired IAS officer Awanish Kumar Awasthi as adviser to CM
79.article_body: Uttar Pradesh government on Friday appointed retired IAS officer Awanish Kumar Awasthi as an adviser to Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath. A temporary post of adviser to the CM has been created till February 28, 2023, to give advice to CM in connection with administrative work, a government order said. Awasthi was the Additional Chief Secretary (Home) in the UP government.

80.title: Our next film together will be Brahmāstra 2: Alia-Ranbir on rumours of rom-com
80.article_body: Speaking about rumours of featuring in a romantic-comedy film together, actors Alia Bhatt and Ranbir Kapoor have stated that their next film together will be 'Brahmāstra: Part Two – Dev'. "Ayan is so protective of me and Ranbir together that I don't know if he will let us do anything apart from the 'Brahmāstra' films," Alia added.

81.title: Pietersen reacts to BJP's tweet on wildlife conservation in Hindi, calls PM 'badhiya aadmi'
81.article_body: After BJP shared a tweet about India recording a substantial rise in the number of wildlife species under PM Narendra Modi's government, South Africa-born ex-England cricketer Kevin Pietersen reacted to the post in Hindi. He thanked PM Modi for his "continued efforts" in supporting wildlife conservation in India. Calling him "badhiya aadmi", Pietersen wrote, "All leaders should follow your lead."

82.title: 'Playboy jobs, male escort jobs' posters seen at Uttarakhand police station
82.article_body: An investigation has been launched by Pauri Garhwal police after posters reading "Playboy jobs, male escort jobs" were put up in Uttarakhand's Kotdwar city. The posters were pasted on walls at Kotdwar bus station, railway station, almost all major squares and even in the office premises of the circle officer of Kotdwar police and the city police station.

83.title: 19-yr-old man flashes private parts, sexually assaults women in queue to see Queen's coffin
83.article_body: A 19-year-old man allegedly flashed his private parts and sexually assaulted at least two women standing in queue to see Queen Elizabeth II's coffin in London. The man, identified as Adio Adeshine, later jumped into the River Thames in an attempt to evade police officers before coming out and being arrested.

84.title: Jadeja's absence will be a massive loss for India in T20 WC: Jayawardena
84.article_body: Former Sri Lanka captain Mahela Jayawardena said the unavailability of all-rounder Ravindra Jadeja for the T20 World Cup 2022 will be a "massive loss" for Team India, considering his form. "It is a tough one for them and probably a concern not having that left-hander. They have switched to leaving out Dinesh Karthik and bringing in Rishabh Pant," added Jayawardena.

85.title: Urban Company's FY22 loss widens to ₹514.14 crore, revenue up 75%
85.article_body: Tiger Global-backed app-based home services marketplace Urban Company reported a consolidated net loss of ₹514.14 crore during FY22 as against ₹249.28 crore loss in FY21. Its revenue during FY22 was up over 75% to ₹509.17 crore as against ₹289.78 crore the preceding fiscal. The Gurugram-based company was founded by Abhiraj Singh Bhal, Varun Khaitan and Raghav Chandra in 2014.

86.title: High tide of 3.12 metres expected in Mumbai at 3:46 pm today, BMC shares post
86.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) took to Twitter to update the city residents about high tide and low tide in Mumbai. In its post, BMC said that there will be a high tide of 3.12 metres at 3:46 pm today. Meanwhile, the low tide is likely to take place at around 9.46 pm with a height of 1.63 metres.

87.title: 14 killed, 10 missing as heavy rains trigger landslides in Nepal
87.article_body: Landslides in Nepal triggered by heavy rains have killed 14 people while 10 others have gone missing, officials said. Home Minister Bal Krishna Khand has ordered the deployment of helicopters for search and rescue operations. As per the official data, at least 48 people have been killed across the country in flash floods and landslides so far this year.

88.title: 16-yr-old missing girl's body recovered from sugarcane field in Assam
88.article_body: The body of a 16-year-old girl, who went missing on September 13, was recovered from a sugarcane field in Assam's Karbi Anglong district on Friday. "A local youth found a pit in the...field when he went to cut...grass there. When we started digging...we recovered a dead body," police said. The deceased's father is suspected to be accused in the case.

89.title: 4 people die of suffocation inside an old well in Andhra Pradesh
89.article_body: Four people, including a father-son duo, died of suffocation inside an old well in Andhra Pradesh's Krishna on Friday, police said. After the father died of suffocation when he went inside the well, the son entered it to save him, but he too died. The other two persons entered the well to rescue the father-son duo, but they too died.

90.title: India Inc's overseas direct investment falls 59% in Aug: RBI data
90.article_body: India Inc's investment in overseas ventures fell by 59% to $1.03 billion on an annual basis in August this year, RBI data showed. Total financial commitment by the domestic firms was worth $1,027.67 million in August 2022-23 as against $2,500.97 million in the corresponding month in 2021-22. Of the total investment, the highest was in the form of equity infusion.

91.title: Actor Sivakarthikeyan criticised for racist comment, says 'All Korean actors look alike'
91.article_body: Actor Sivakarthikeyan, known for films like Remo and Doctor, is being criticised on social media over his racist comments on Korean people. While speaking at a school's cultural event in Tamil Nadu, Sivakarthikeyan said, "Whenever I see Korean films, I feel like all the actors in them are the same."

92.title: 3rd elephant found dead in 3 months in Jharkhand, tusks missing
92.article_body: A 12-year-old elephant was found dead in a forest in Jharkhand's Ramgarh district, an official said on Saturday. "We found that [the] two tusks of the dead elephant [were] missing. It seems they were chopped off," Mandu Forest Range Officer Suresh Ram said. This is the third elephant carcass to be found in the state in three months.

93.title: A character is like scar on soul: Kangana pens note amid 'Emergency' shoot
93.article_body: Actress Kangana Ranaut on Saturday took to Instagram to pen a note on identity crisis amid the shoot of her second directorial 'Emergency'. She wrote, "You dissolve in the character...nothing of you is left in you. You see your own pictures like a stranger...once a character has happened to you it remains like a scar on the soul."

94.title: Uber staff reacted to hacker's post on internal chat with emoji, screenshot surfaces
94.article_body: A screenshot showing Uber employees' reaction to an alleged teen hacker announcing on the company's internal chat that Uber has suffered a breach has surfaced online. The screenshot shows employees reacting to the post with lighthearted emoji like sirens and popcorn and GIFs. Many employees appeared to have initially thought it was a joke and even interacted with the hacker.

95.title: For decades no effort was made to rehabilitate cheetahs: PM Modi
95.article_body: PM Narendra Modi has said that it's unfortunate that cheetahs were declared extinct in India in 1952, "but for decades no meaningful effort was made to rehabilitate them". This comes as PM Modi released eight cheetahs from Namibia at Madhya Pradesh's Kuno National Park on the occasion of his birthday today. "Today, the country has started rehabilitating cheetahs," he added.

96.title: Funnel cloud forms over Disney World in US; video goes viral
96.article_body: A large funnel-shaped cloud formation was seen over the Walt Disney World Florida, US. Commenting on the video shared by a Twitter user, people speculated that the cloud was a tornado. However, the US National Weather Service (NWS) later tweeted, "Looks like it could be a funnel cloud, hard to tell if there is any rotation in the video though."

97.title: Couldn't speak Hindi, wasn't a B'wood buff before acting: Alaya F
97.article_body: Actress Alaya F revealed that she could not speak Hindi, could not dance and was not a Bollywood buff before becoming an actor. She further said her mother Pooja Bedi and grandfather Kabir Bedi would have advised her not to become an actor. "But I'm someone if I set my mind on something, I'll do it to death," she added.

98.title: I was so intimidated on the first day I met Mr Bachchan: Rashmika
98.article_body: Speaking about her first meeting with veteran actor Amitabh Bachchan, actress Rashmika Mandanna said that she was "so intimidated because of his whole aura". She added, "I'm glad I got to do my first proper Hindi film with Bachchan sir. He's the best teacher of them all." The two will be seen as a father-daughter duo in 'Goodbye'.

99.title: CCTV shows no leopard even as Gurugram people claim sightings, cages set up
99.article_body: Despite several residents of Gurugram's DLF Phase 5 claiming to have sighted a leopard in the locality, wildlife officials have said that nothing of the sort has been captured on CCTV. Team also found no pug marks in the area. However, wildlife officials have set up two cages in the area to trap the leopard in case there is one.

100.title: Nora Fatehi's brother-in-law received BMW worth ₹65 lakh from conman Sukesh: Reports
100.article_body: Actress-dancer Nora Fatehi's brother-in-law, Bobby, received BMW worth ₹65 lakh from conman Sukesh Chandrasekhar as a gift, according to reports. Bobby and Sukesh's aide Pinki Irani were reportedly cross-examined together by Delhi Police's Economic Offences Wing. Nora reportedly told the officials that she never met Sukesh in person and was in touch with him through WhatsApp.

101.title: Stalin, a mere doll; power is with his family: AIADMK leader Palaniswami
101.article_body: AIADMK interim chief Edappadi K Palaniswami (EPS) on Friday termed the DMK government in Tamil Nadu a family regime. "In Tamil Nadu there are about four Chief Ministers. The family is the power-centre, which wields power. Today, Chief Minister Stalin looks like a doll," Palaniswami alleged. He further claimed that people of the state have only suffered under DMK's rule.

102.title: Flood alert issued in Pune after discharge of water into Mula-Mutha rivers
102.article_body: Pune administration issued a flood alert to citizens residing alongside the Mula-Mutha rivers following the highest discharge of water this year. "The four dams upstream of Mutha...are filled to capacity prompting water to be discharged from all dams- Panshet, Varasgaon, Temghar and Khadakwasla," an official said. The water discharge into Khadakwasla is the highest this year, the official added.

103.title: Railway Minister takes part in 'Swachhata Pakhwada' on PM Modi's birthday
103.article_body: On the occasion of Prime Minister Narendra Modi's 72nd birthday, Railway Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw took part in the 'Swachhata Pakhwada' at Hazrat Nizamuddin railway station in the national capital. "From today, a campaign for cleanliness has started in Indian Railways, post offices, telecom, IT and other departments of the country...Cleanliness is a great synonym for service," said Vaishnaw.

104.title: 'Laal...' isn't a short-term film that can be hit or flop: Mona Singh
104.article_body: Actress Mona Singh, who portrays the mother of Aamir Khan's character in 'Laal Singh Chaddha', stated that the film is not "a short-term film" that can be labelled a hit or flop. She added, "It will stay with people for a long time." 'Laal Singh Chaddha' was made on a ₹180 crore budget and collected around ₹130 crore worldwide.

105.title: Kartik knows exactly what audience likes, no wonder he's successful: Alaya F
105.article_body: Actress Alaya F said that actor Kartik Aaryan knows exactly what the audience likes, adding that it's no wonder he is as successful as he is. The two will be seen together in the upcoming film 'Freddy'. "Shooting...with Kartik was wonderful, he is actually a really really talented guy, he is so good at what he does," the actress added.

106.title: Shiv Sena MP Sanjay Raut played a major role in Patra Chawl scam: ED
106.article_body: The Enforcement Directorate opposed Shiv Sena MP Sanjay Raut's bail plea in the special PMLA court and claimed that Raut played a major role in laundering money in the Patra Chawl scam. "In order to avoid trial, Sanjay Raut has been operating behind the curtains with his confidant Pravin Raut as his frontman," said ED.

107.title: Johnny Depp-Amber Heard trial adapted into film, releases on Sep 30
107.article_body: The defamation trial between actors Johnny Depp and Amber Heard has been adapted into a film titled 'Hot Take: The Depp/Heard Trial' and will release on an OTT platform on September 30. The film features Mark Hapka as Depp and Megan Davis as Heard. Actresses Melissa Marty and Mary Carrig will portray the lawyers Camille Vasquez and Elaine Bredehoft, respectively.

108.title: Will not give authority to Kerala govt to appoint vice-chancellors: Guv
108.article_body: Commenting on the University Laws Amendment Bill, Kerala Governor Arif Mohammed Khan said that he will not give the authority to the state government to appoint vice-chancellors. "I am saying it clearly, this will amount to executive interference," he added. All the appointments in the universities will be made on the basis of merit, Governor Khan further said.

109.title: E-auction of over 1,200 mementos, gifts given to PM Modi begins
109.article_body: A 16-day e-auction of over 1,200 mementos and gifts given to PM Narendra Modi began on Saturday. The Ministry of Culture invited people to participate in the e-auction, which will continue till October 2, through pmmementos.gov.in. The items have been put on display at the National Gallery of Modern Art (NGMA) in New Delhi.

110.title: Lebanese banks to shut after string of hold-ups amid economic crisis
110.article_body: Banks in Lebanon will close for three days next week following a string of raids by customers demanding access to their frozen savings. As many as seven banks have been held up since Wednesday. Lebanon is in a severe economic crisis and the banks in the country have been applying strict withdrawal limits on foreign currency assets since 2019.

111.title: Duo shoot cab driver dead, run away with cab in Gurugram; arrested
111.article_body: Two persons were arrested after they allegedly booked a cab, shot the driver dead in Gurugram's Pataudi and then ran away with the vehicle. "The suspects booked a cab for Delhi with...intention to steal it and flee to a hill station," ACP Crime-I Preet Pal said. The accused ran out of fuel in Nuh and abandoned the cab, police said.

112.title: FedEx shares post biggest 1-day drop in over 40 years, wiping out $11 billion
112.article_body: Shares of FedEx plunged more than 21% on Friday, marking the biggest one-day drop in the company's stock since at least 1980. FedEx lost $11 billion in market value, wiping out two years of stock gains. The decline in its stock was triggered after FedEx withdrew its earnings forecast and announced cost-cutting measures, including closure of 90 office locations.

113.title: India have taken a risk by picking only 4 pacers for T20 WC: Johnson
113.article_body: Ex-Australia pacer Mitchell Johnson said Team India have taken a "risk" by picking only four pacers in their squad for T20 World Cup 2022. "In Australia, you surely need to play three pacers, possibly four in certain conditions, for example, Perth," added Johnson. "The main thing in Australia is the extra bounce and pace and adjusting your length," he stated.

114.title: Video shows PM Modi clicking photos of cheetahs after releasing them in MP
114.article_body: PM Narendra Modi could be seen clicking photos of the cheetahs he released in Madhya Pradesh's Kuno National Park on his birthday on Saturday. CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan also accompanied him to the site. Eight cheetahs have been brought to India from Namibia through a special chartered cargo flight that landed on Saturday morning.

115.title: Man breaks queue and runs towards Queen's coffin; pics surface
115.article_body: Pictures showing a man breaking queue and running towards Queen's coffin have surfaced on social media. The man has been arrested after he approached the coffin at Westminster Hall on Friday. The live video feed of the Queen lying in state cut away for a brief period during the incident.

116.title: Karnataka CM distributes electric 2-wheelers to sanitation workers
116.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai on Friday distributed electric two-wheelers to sanitation workers who are working at the Vidhana Soudha, Vikasa Soudha and MS Buildings in Bengaluru. He said that the sanitation workers "move in cars in Western countries and now the same thing is happening here". The scheme has been extended to ten municipal corporations across the state, he added.

117.title: Rise of ISIS, al-Qaeda in Afghanistan puts world in grave danger: Ex-US NSA
117.article_body: Former US National Security Advisor (NSA) John Bolton said the rapid rise of ISIS, al-Qaeda terrorist network in Afghanistan has put not only Afghanistan but the rest of the world in "grave danger". Bolton also accused the Taliban government of having ties with international terrorist groups and failing to comply with the provisions of the Doha Agreement to battle terrorism.

118.title: Don't use violent measures to tackle stray dogs: Kerala CM urges people
118.article_body: Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan on Friday urged the people not to resort to violent measures to deal with the stray dog menace in the state. Beating, poisoning and tying up dogs on streets will not solve the problem, CM Vijayan said, adding, "Indulging in such acts is unacceptable." This comes amid reports of rising attacks by dogs in the state.

119.title: AAP MLA Amanatullah Khan's business partner arrested under Arms Act
119.article_body: Delhi AAP MLA Amanatullah Khan's business partner Hamid Ali has been arrested under Arms Act. This comes after the Delhi Police's Anti-Corruption Branch (ACB) on Friday raided his premises, along with that of Khan's, in connection with a two-year-old corruption case involving the Delhi Waqf Board. A pistol, some bullets and ₹12 lakh in cash were recovered from Ali's residence.

120.title: When films don't make revenue, stars always get blamed: Nagarjuna
120.article_body: Actor Nagarjuna has stated that when films don't generate revenue, the stars always get the blame. "The way a film is marketed is...for stars and stardom...That's what you have to be careful of. Right now I've fallen away from that trap," he said. He added that even as a superstar, he wants fans to appreciate his film, efforts and creativity.

121.title: You can't ignore women anymore, there's no excuse: FM to companies
121.article_body: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said companies need to hire more women in leadership positions and also widen the female directors' base. She said women aren't asking for gender parity and inclusivity but if "you want profit, get us in". "There is just no excuse...you cannot ignore us anymore," Sitharaman added. The average number of women on Indian boards is 1.03.

122.title: PM Modi releases 8 cheetahs from Namibia at Kuno National Park on his birthday
122.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi released eight cheetahs brought from Namibia at the Kuno National Park in MP on his birthday on Saturday. The cheetahs were brought in a special plane that landed in Gwalior. The cheetahs were flown from southern Africa for their reintroduction in India seven decades after the species was declared extinct in the country in 1952.

123.title: Congress to launch 800 km 'Bharat Jodo Yatra - Assam': Jairam Ramesh
123.article_body: The Congress party will launch the Assam version of its Bharat Jodo Yatra on November 1. The party will cover about 800 km from Dhubri to Sadiya as part of 'Bharat Jodo Yatra - Assam', senior party leader Jairam Ramesh tweeted on Friday. "The country is facing tremendous economic inequality, social polarisation and centralisation of power," he said in Guwahati.

124.title: India's current account deficit may remain within 3% of GDP: RBI
124.article_body: India's current account deficit (CAD) may remain within 3% of the GDP in 2022-23 as against 1.2% during the last fiscal, RBI's bulletin said. India's trade deficit during the first five months of FY23 widened to $124.5 billion from $54 billion in the previous corresponding period. The CAD is an important indicator of the balance of payments of a country.

125.title: Warne was better than me, I learnt things from him: Muralitharan
125.article_body: Sri Lankan legend Muttiah Muralitharan said late Australian cricketer Shane Warne was "better" than him. "I looked up to him and learnt things from him. We all miss him," added Muralitharan. "If he had...played the same as me...he would have got more wickets than me...What he has done for spin bowling is more than anyone," Muralitharan had earlier stated.

126.title: AAP backs MLA arrested in corruption case, calls case 'outright fake'
126.article_body: AAP defended MLA Amanatullah Khan, who was arrested on Friday in connection with irregularities in Delhi Waqf Board recruitment and called the case baseless and outright fake. The party said, "Nothing was found from his residence or office during the raid. This is a new conspiracy to implicate the MLA in a false case and defame the AAP."

127.title: Govt cuts windfall tax on domestic crude oil, ATF, diesel export
127.article_body: The government reduced the windfall tax on domestically produced crude oil to ₹10,500 from ₹13,300 a tonne, according to a Ministry of Finance circular. It also reduced the tax on the export of diesel to ₹8.5 per litre from ₹13.5 and on aviation turbine fuel (ATF) from ₹9 per litre to ₹5. The new rates will be effective from Saturday.

128.title: Kerala HC upholds beedi tycoon's life term for security guard's murder
128.article_body: Kerala High Court has upheld 'beedi' tycoon Mohammed Nisham's life imprisonment. Nisham, in 2016, was given a life sentence by a Thrissur court for a security guard's murder in January 2015. The incident happened when Nisham was returning from a party to his apartment in his SUV and he attacked the guard over a delay in opening the gate.

129.title: Ayan Mukerji to make separate films on 'Jalastra', 'Vanarastra': Report
129.article_body: Following the success of 'Brahmāstra: Part One – Shiva', filmmaker Ayan Mukerji is set to make separate films on 'Jalastra' and 'Vanarastra', as per reports. The spin-off films will reportedly explore the origin of the astras and feature Ranbir Kapoor and Alia Bhatt. Ayan said earlier that he is already thinking about an origin story for Shah Rukh Khan's character.

130.title: Sus-Pashan bridge officially opens for public in Pune
130.article_body: The Sus-Pashan bridge in Pune was officially opened for the public in the presence of Maharashtra minister Chandrakant Patil and Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) officers on Friday. The construction work for the bridge, which was built at a cost of ₹41 crore, was started in 2020. PMC Additional Municipal Commissioner (Estate) Kunal Khemnar said, "We've completed...bridge well before its deadline."

131.title: Over 100 mangroves in Navi Mumbai destroyed, FIR registered
131.article_body: The Navi Mumbai unit of the forest department registered a case against a Karanjade resident for destroying around 100 mangroves in Vaghivali village of Panvel. The FIR was filed after a site visit on August 18, 2022. According to the complaint, the man, identified as Kundan Vilash Bhoir, created a fishing pond by building an earthen embankment, killing 100-125 mangroves.

132.title: Leonardo is a big 'Squid Game' fan, we can ask him to join: Director
132.article_body: Korean drama show 'Squid Game' director-writer Hwang Dong-hyuk was recently asked if any Hollywood celebrities will be a part of the second season. He said, "That's not in the plan and if the stage changes, maybe in Season 3...Leonardo DiCaprio did say he's a big fan of 'Squid Game' so maybe...we can ask him to join the games."

133.title: I'll take all reviews into consideration before Brahmāstra 2: Ayan
133.article_body: Filmmaker Ayan Mukerji has stated that he is happy with the performance of his film 'Brahmāstra: Part One – Shiva' at the box office. "I haven't been able to absorb all those reviews, be it negative reviews, fan theories or what people did not like...I will take all that into consideration before moving on to part two," the filmmaker said.

134.title: Amit Shah extends birthday wishes to PM Modi, calls him ‘most beloved leader’
134.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah wished Prime Minister Narendra Modi on his birthday and called him the "most beloved leader". He also lauded the PM's efforts in making impossible tasks possible with his "India-first" thinking and determination for the welfare of the poor. "I pray to God for his good health and long life," said Shah.

135.title: Gautam Adani appointed Chairman of Ambuja Cements, son Karan to head ACC
135.article_body: Gautam Adani has been appointed as the Chairman of Ambuja Cements, while his elder son Karan has been named ACC Chairman. Karan, who also serves as Adani Ports and SEZ CEO, has been appointed as Director of both cement companies. Notably, Adani Group has become the second-largest cement maker in the country after acquiring the cement business from Switzerland-based Holcim.

136.title: Arrested TMC leader’s Birbhum house raided in cattle smuggling case
136.article_body: The CBI raided TMC leader Anubrata Mondal’s Birbhum house in connection with the cattle smuggling case. The CBI officials also questioned his daughter Sukanya. She is allegedly a shareholder in the rice mill associated with her father. The TMC leader was arrested in August and then later sent to 14-day judicial custody by the CBI Special Court.

137.title: Casting couch not limited to Bollywood, happens everywhere: Shama
137.article_body: Television actress Shama Sikander has stated that casting couch is not limited to Bollywood alone, adding that it happens everywhere. "Some of these producers and makers were well-established names in the industry," she added. Shama further called "the whole concept of asking for sex in return for work" the lowest of low, adding that they are terribly insecure human beings.

138.title: No evidence that sensitive user data was stolen: Uber on latest hack
138.article_body: Uber said it has found "no evidence" that sensitive user data was compromised in a breach of its internal computer systems. A reportedly 18-year-old hacker gained access to an employee's Slack account on Thursday and posted a message saying, "Uber has suffered a data breach." Uber said internal software tools that it took down after the hack are being restored.

139.title: 8 from Ludhiana, including 2 Cong councillors & ex-SAD councillor, join AAP
139.article_body: As many as eight leaders from Ludhiana, including two Congress councillors Amrit Varsha Rampal and Kala Gautam, joined AAP on Friday. Former two-time SAD councillor Tanvir Singh Dhaliwal also joined AAP in presence of the party's state general secretary Harchand Singh Barsat and Ludhiana west MLA Gurpreet Gogi. Former Congress councillor Satwinder Singh Jabaddi was also inducted into AAP.

140.title: Just because a film is loved, you can't milk it: Dulquer on remakes
140.article_body: Speaking about remakes and sequels of classic films, actor Dulquer Salmaan said that just because a film is loved and has done well doesn't mean you can milk it. "Every time we love a classic film, I don't think you should do a sequel or do anything...It is like the golden egg story. You can't kill the goose," he added.

141.title: Am I needed to weaken Congress, isn't Rahul Gandhi enough: Kejriwal
141.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Friday rejected allegations that he was acting as a 'B-team' of the BJP and weakening the Congress. "Am I needed to weaken the Congress? Isn't Rahul Gandhi enough," said Kejriwal. Asked about efforts to form a grand Opposition alliance, he said, "I am not against anybody. But I don't understand this politics of alliance."

142.title: Police wait for thieves as they run after robbing Delhi man, arrest them
142.article_body: Two thieves were arrested after they stole cash and jewellery worth over ₹5 lakh from the house of a 67-year-old man in Delhi. The police officials were reportedly waiting a few metres from the building to arrest the robbers after having tracked them down in connection with a past theft case. Reports said that shots were fired from both sides.

143.title: There's only one SRK: Dulquer on comparison between 'Veer-Zaara', 'Sita Ramam'
143.article_body: Speaking about the comparison between 'Veer-Zaara' and 'Sita Ramam', actor Dulquer Salmaan said that comparing him with Shah Rukh Khan is insulting to the latter, adding, "There is only one Shah Rukh Khan." Dulquer further said, "He is such a model for all of us to follow. How he treats people, how he talks to them...He is very special."

144.title: Police seize 1.4 kg heroin worth ₹7 crore in Gurugram, 2 arrested
144.article_body: Gurugram Police recovered 1.4 kg of heroin worth ₹7 crore from an apartment in Sector-12 on Sheetla Mata Road on Friday. Two men, including an Afghan national, were arrested in connection with the case. According to police, the contraband was found concealed in pouches hidden in the apartment. The suspects received the drugs from their associates in Afghanistan, police added.

145.title: India votes in favour of Ukraine Prez addressing UNGA virtually
145.article_body: India was among the 101 countries that voted on Friday in favour of allowing Ukraine President Volodymyr Zelenskyy to address the high-level UN General Assembly (UNGA) session next week. A total of seven nations voted against it. Meanwhile, the 193-member assembly has rejected an amendment proposed by Belarus to allow any leader facing exceptional difficulties to deliver a pre-recorded address.

146.title: Get price drops on Samsung Galaxy S22 Plus, S21 FE and more: Flipkart
146.article_body: Flipkart revealed that as part of Big Billion Days sale, Samsung Galaxy S22 Plus and Galaxy S21 FE are priced at ₹59,999* and ₹31,999* respectively, with a 30% and 50% discount on their current selling prices. Galaxy S22 Plus will be available for purchase right away through Flipkart's 'Sale Price Live' program. Flipkart Big Billion Days starts from September 23.

147.title: A human tragedy has occurred: Mahindra CEO after woman killed by loan recovery agent
147.article_body: Mahindra Group CEO Anish Shah has issued a statement after a pregnant woman in Jharkhand was mowed to death by a loan recovery agent forcibly driving a tractor away. "We are deeply saddened and disturbed...A human tragedy has occurred," wrote Shah. The company will investigate the incident and review the practice of using third-party collection agencies, the CEO further said.

148.title: How can she be innocent yet portray seduction, uff: Kangana on Sridevi
148.article_body: Actress Kangana Ranaut on Friday took to Instagram Stories to share a clip of late veteran actress Sridevi's song 'Kate Nahin Kat Te' from the 1987 film 'Mr. India'. The actress wrote alongside the clip, "It is beyond me how anyone can be childlike innocent/funny and yet portray intoxicating feminine seduction...Ufff...I am Sridevi Ji's biggest fan. Legend."

149.title: More nervous than I was on int'l debut: Gambhir on playing Legends League Cricket
149.article_body: Ex-India opener Gautam Gambhir said he's "way more nervous" about playing in Legends League Cricket 2022 than he was when he made his international debut. "I have not played cricket for a very long time," added Gambhir. Gambhir will be leading India Capitals. "Captaincy will always be challenging for...me...[I]...[expect] a lot from myself and the other players," he stated.

150.title: Charminar, Golconda Fort lit up in Tricolour for Hyd Liberation Day
150.article_body: Hyderabad's iconic monuments Charminar and Golconda Fort were lit up in Tricolour on Friday night on the eve of 75th Hyderabad Liberation Day. A year-long celebration has been planned to mark the liberation of the state of Hyderabad. Union Culture Minister G Kishan Reddy tweeted images of the two monuments. He also shared an anthem to commemorate Hyderabad Liberation Day.

151.title: Biggest wildlife incident of this century: MP CM on cheetahs' arrival
151.article_body: Madhya Pradesh CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan has said that the arrival of eight cheetahs in the state from Namibia today is the "biggest wildlife incident of this century". Adding that there's "no greater gift" for the state than the cheetahs' arrival in Kuno National Park, he further said, "[Cheetahs] had gone extinct and it's a historic step to reintroduce them."

152.title: Meghalaya stops plans to open casinos amid resistance from Church
152.article_body: Meghalaya government has decided to stop its plans to establish casinos in the state following resistance from the Church and social organisations. Earlier, the state government had given provisional licences to three firms for opening casinos in a bid to boost tourism and revenue. The provisional licences will "lapse automatically" if the process doesn't start, state CM Conrad Sangma said.

153.title: Special chartered flight carrying 8 cheetahs from Namibia lands in Gwalior
153.article_body: The special chartered cargo flight bringing eight cheetahs from Namibia landed at the Indian Air Force Station in Madhya Pradesh's Gwalior on Saturday. After all necessary formalities, including paperwork, at Gwalior, the cheetahs will be flown to Palpur village in two helicopters, an official said. Prime Minister Narendra Modi will release the cheetahs into Kuno National Park in MP today.

154.title: J&J's baby powder production licence cancelled in Maharashtra, recall ordered
154.article_body: The Maharashtra government has cancelled the manufacturing licence of Johnson & Johnson's baby powder with immediate effect after it found a sample drawn for inspection to be of sub-standard quality. The use of the product may affect the health of new-born babies' skin, Maharashtra FDA said. It has further ordered Johnson & Johnson to recall the powder from the market.

155.title: 22-yr-old 'beaten to death' by Iran police over improper hijab; actress Remini shares pic
155.article_body: A 22-year-old woman has died in an Iranian hospital days after being detained by police over 'improper hijab'. Witnesses reported that Mahsa Amini was beaten in a police van, while the police denied the allegations. American actress Leah Remini shared a picture of the victim and tweeted, "Her mother said, 'Let the world know they killed my daughter.'"

156.title: Adani Group overtakes Tata Group as India's largest business house
156.article_body: Adani Group, led by the world's second richest person Gautam Adani, has become India's largest business house with a total market capitalisation of ₹20.74 lakh crore. The conglomerate overtook Tata Group which holds a combined market value of ₹20.7 lakh crore as of Friday. Notably, Adani Group added ₹18.7 lakh crore to its market value in less than three years.

157.title: ‘Liberation’ is a wrong word: Owaisi on Hyderabad National Liberation Day
157.article_body: Reacting to Hyderabad Liberation Day, AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi said that the word "liberation" is wrong as Hyderabad will always remain an integral part of India. Earlier, Owaisi had written a letter to Union Home Minister Amit Shah and Telangana CM KCR, seeking the renaming of Hyderabad Liberation Day to National Integration Day.

158.title: India reports 5,747 new COVID-19 cases, active cases stand at 46,848
158.article_body: India has reported 5,747 new COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. The data showed that 5,618 people recovered in the last 24 hours following which the active COVID-19 cases in the country dropped to 46,848. This comes a day after 6,298 new COVID-19 cases were reported in India.

159.title: Pics show 8 cheetahs from Namibia being unloaded from special plane in Gwalior
159.article_body: Union Minister for Civil Aviation Jyotiraditya Scindia shared pictures showing eight cheetahs from Namibia being unloaded from the special plane at Gwalior airport. The cheetahs will be transported in helicopters to the Kuno National Park in Sheopur district of Madhya Pradesh. "This is the biggest wildlife incident of this century. This will rapidly boost tourism," MP CM Shivraj Chouhan said.

160.title: How did the US media praise PM Modi for telling Putin it's not the time for war?
160.article_body: The mainstream American media praised PM Narendra Modi for telling Russian President Vladimir Putin that this is not the time for war in Ukraine. "Modi rebukes Putin over war in Ukraine," The Washington Post wrote. "India's Leader Tells Putin That Now Is Not an Era for War," The New York Times said in its headline.

161.title: How did the US media praise PM Modi for telling Putin it's not the time for war?
161.article_body: The mainstream American media praised PM Narendra Modi for telling Russian President Vladimir Putin that this is not the time for war in Ukraine. "Modi rebukes Putin over war in Ukraine," The Washington Post wrote. "India's Leader Tells Putin That Now Is Not an Era for War," The New York Times said in its headline.

162.title: Man carries gun as he takes kids to Kerala school amid rising attacks by dogs
162.article_body: A video showing a father carrying an air gun while escorting his daughter and a group of children to school in Kerala's Kasaragod amid rising attacks by dogs has surfaced online. He can be heard saying he'd shoot if any dog tries to attack. He told media that it was his responsibility as a father to ensure his children's protection.

163.title: Bengaluru sees dip in new COVID-19 cases with 230 infections
163.article_body: The number of new COVID-19 cases in Bengaluru dropped to 230 on Friday, down from 283 reported a day before, according to BBMP. This takes the cumulative case count to 18,69,754. No new deaths were reported, so the overall toll remained at 16,987. The number of active cases was 2,480, while the infection positivity rate dropped to 2.00%.

164.title: 5 soldiers killed in Israeli strike on Damascus airport: Syria
164.article_body: Five soldiers were killed after Israel carried out an airstrike on Syria's Damascus International Airport and other positions south of the capital, Syria's Defence Ministry said on Saturday. Syria's air defences intercepted the hostile missiles in its airspace and shot some of them down, it added. Israel had reportedly launched missile attacks on Syria's Aleppo airport in the past month.

165.title: 6 JSW plant employees dead, over 20 injured after truck hits bus in Odisha
165.article_body: As many as six JSW plant employees died and over 20 others were injured after a speeding coal-laden truck hit a bus on Odisha's Jharsuguda-Sambalpur Biju Expressway on Friday. "Most employees are severely injured. 10 people have been referred to a hospital in Burla, Sambalpur while 14 are under treatment here," Jharsuguda DSP N Mohapatra said.

166.title: Varanasi nominated as first-ever SCO Tourism and Cultural Capital
166.article_body: The city of Varanasi was nominated as the first-ever Shanghai Cooperation Organisation (SCO) Tourism and Cultural Capital for the period of 2022 to 2023 on Friday. This comes as the 22nd SCO Summit was being held in Uzbekistan's Samarkand. "The nomination...will promote tourism, cultural and humanitarian exchanges between India and the SCO member Countries," the Ministry of External Affairs said.

167.title: Pregnant woman dies as loan recovery agent runs tractor over her in Jharkhand
167.article_body: A 27-year-old pregnant woman was crushed to death after a loan recovery agent allegedly ran a tractor over her in Hazaribagh, Jharkhand. The woman's father said he received a message demanding payment of ₹1.3 lakh outstanding dues immediately or the tractor would be taken away. The woman was mowed to death when the agent was trying to confiscate the vehicle.

168.title: Fearing exams, 14-year-old Hyderabad boy runs away from home
168.article_body: A 14-year-old boy from Hyderabad's Chanchalguda allegedly ran away from his home out of fear of the fast-approaching exams. The boy's father filed a missing complaint after which a search was launched. The boy was found by the Hanamkonda Police, said his brother-in-law. The father then headed to Hanamkonda to bring his boy back.

169.title: Mumbai people may have to pay ₹6 lakh for 0001 on car number plate: Maha Dept
169.article_body: A new draft notification by Maharashtra Transport Department said that residents of Mumbai, Thane, Pune and other cities may have to pay ₹6 lakh to get 0001 as their car registration number. Meanwhile, residents may have to pay ₹1 lakh for this number for their two-wheelers. The Transport Department has proposed to hike fee for VIP registration numbers by 50%.

170.title: Delhi govt to launch training programme for EV mechanics
170.article_body: The Delhi government on Friday announced its plans of creating a training programme for electric vehicle (EV) mechanics. The government stated that the Delhi Skill and Entrepreneurship University (DSEU) will design a course to train students of its automobile engineering diploma programme to become EV mechanics. Every year, about 100 students will be trained in basic and advanced EV mechanics.

171.title: 'Sex Tantra Camp' cancelled in Pune after outfits oppose it: Police
171.article_body: A 'Sex Tantra Camp' which was being organised in Pune was called off on Friday after various outfits opposed it, the police said. The camp offered training in various tantra techniques for a fee of ₹15,000 and was scheduled to take place during the Navratri festival. A case had also been filed against the camp's organisers, an official said.

172.title: Queen Elizabeth's funeral poses biggest ever security test: London Police
172.article_body: London's police force said Queen Elizabeth II's state funeral will be the biggest security operation it has ever undertaken. As a single event, this is larger than the 2012 Olympics and Queen's Platinum Jubilee, London's Metropolitan Police Deputy Assistant Commissioner, Stuart Cundy, said. The force is preparing for events ranging from terrorism threats to protests and crowd crushes, he added.

173.title: Mob beats up 2 women on suspicion of being child-lifters in Thane
173.article_body: A mob allegedly beat up two women on suspicion of being child-lifters in Thane's Mumbra area on Friday. "The two women in burkhas were roaming in the locality and are beggars. Some residents of the colony spotted them and assuming them as child-lifters they were thrashed," a senior police official said. They were rescued after a passer-by informed the police.

174.title: Stray dog seen sleeping on a hospital bed in MP; video goes viral
