174.article_body: A video of a dog sleeping on a hospital bed in Madhya Pradesh's Ratlam has gone viral on social media. Ratlam Chief Medical and Health Officer Dr Prabhakar Nanaware said that he was unaware of the incident as he was on leave. The video was reportedly shot at a government hospital in Alot.

175.title: Invitation sent to Harry, Meghan for state reception at Buckingham Palace cancelled: Reports
175.article_body: The invitation sent to Harry and Meghan Markle for the state reception, to be hosted by King Charles and Queen Consort Camilla, at Buckingham Palace has been cancelled, according to reports. The decision was taken after officials at Buckingham Palace insisted the reception was for working Royals only, reports said. World leaders, ambassadors and foreign Royals will attend the reception.

176.title: BBMP stops demolition drive in Mahadevapura, re-survey to be done
176.article_body: The Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) has stopped the demolition drive in the Mahadevapura zone and set up a task force to conduct a re-survey to find encroachments. The survey will be carried out in places like Wipro, Prestige Tech Park and Vagdevi Layout, said a BBMP official. The demolition drive against Nalapad Academy has also been put on hold.

177.title: 22-year-old arrested in Pune for posing as policeman, cheating student
177.article_body: A 22-year-old man, who allegedly posed as a policeman and cheated a college student in Pune, has been arrested, police said. The accused intercepted a college student in the Sinhagad Road area, police added. The accused falsely claimed that the victim indulged in prostitution by bringing girls to his house and also allegedly took money from him, police stated.

178.title: China puts on hold proposal to designate Mumbai attacks planner Sajid as global terrorist
178.article_body: China has put a hold on a proposal moved at the United Nations by the US and co-supported by India to designate Lashkar-e-Taiba (LeT) terrorist Sajid Mir, one of India's most wanted terrorists and the main handler of the 26/11 Mumbai attacks, as a global terrorist. Mir has a bounty of $5 million placed on his head by the US.

179.title: 2 killed after building collapses in Delhi's Johripur Extension
179.article_body: Two people were killed and seven others were injured after a building which was under renovation collapsed in Delhi's Johripur Extension on Friday. Earlier, it was reported that two people were trapped under the debris and rescue operations were underway. Legal action has been initiated, police said. Moreover, Delhi Municipal Corporation said that the building was "over 20 years old".

180.title: ₹140 cr scam accused frees hand from police in Gurugram, held after chase
180.article_body: A prisoner, who is an accused in a ₹140-crore scam, attempted to escape from police custody in Gurugram. FIR stated that police sounded alarm as soon as the prisoner tried to escape and a Sub-Inspector was able to catch him after a distance of over 100 metres. However, he was able to run again, following which, he fell on road.

181.title: What is 'Impact Player' rule BCCI is introducing in T20 tournaments?
181.article_body: BCCI will introduce 'Impact Player' rule in its T20 tournaments. With this, teams can replace a member of their playing XI during a match if they think it'll be useful. 'Impact Player' can be introduced any time before completion of 14th over of either innings. Player replaced by 'Impact Player' can no longer take part in remainder of the match.

182.title: 19-year-old youth shot dead during party in north Delhi, 1 arrested
182.article_body: A 19-year-old youth was shot dead during a party in north Delhi's Subzi Mandi area and one person was arrested in connection with the incident, police said. According to witnesses, someone mistakenly fired a shot and the bullet hit the victim's neck, police added. The victim was rushed to a hospital where doctors declared him dead, police stated.

183.title: Mumbai teacher on way to staff room dies after getting stuck in school lift
183.article_body: A 26-year-old teacher died after getting stuck in the lift of a school building in Mumbai's Malad (west) on Friday. The teacher was reportedly on her way to the school's staff room when the lift suddenly started moving upwards. The deceased got stuck in the lift and was injured. She was taken to the hospital but was declared dead.

184.title: Chile loses FIFA appeal in World Cup case with Ecuador
184.article_body: Chile have lost its appeal to replace Ecuador at FIFA World Cup in Qatar. FIFA dismissed Chile’s argument that Ecuador player Byron Castillo was actually Colombian and ineligible to play in qualifying games. Castillo played in eight of them for Ecuador. Had Ecuador forfeited all eight games, Chile would've risen to fourth automatic qualification place in South American qualifying group.

185.title: I have always looked up to you and admired you: Serena Williams to Roger Federer
185.article_body: Penning a note for Roger Federer following his retirement from tennis, Serena Williams wrote on Instagram, "I have always looked up to you and admired you." She added, "You inspired countless millions and millions of people, including me, and we will never forget." She further wrote, "Welcome to the retirement club. And thank you for being you @rogerfederer."

186.title: Heavy rains claim at least 22 lives in UP
186.article_body: Heavy overnight rains killed at least 22 people in Uttar Pradesh on Friday. The deaths included nine labourers from Jhansi, who died after an under-construction wall collapsed on their huts in Lucknow. Only one man survived the accident. The remaining 13 deaths were reported from Unnao, Fatehpur, Prayagraj, Sitapur, Raebareli and Jhansi, officials said.

187.title: Live-stream proceedings of national importance: Indira Jaising to SC
187.article_body: Senior advocate Indira Jaising has written a letter to Chief Justice of India UU Lalit and other Supreme Court judges urging them to begin live-streaming of proceedings of matters of national importance. Citing freedom of information, she added, "There is no substitute for first-hand knowledge, especially in the era of...'fake news'." Jaising said the apex court should've its own channel.

188.title: PM Modi thanks Uzbek Prez for hosting SCO summit; discusses ties
188.article_body: PM Narendra Modi met Uzbekistan President Shavkat Mirziyoyev in Samarkand on Friday. "Had a great meeting with President Shavkat Mirziyoyev. Thanked him for hosting the SCO (Shanghai Cooperation Organisation) Summit," Modi tweeted. The two leaders discussed "ways to deepen connectivity, trade and cultural cooperation between India and Uzbekistan", according to the tweet.

189.title: German Chancellor Scholz, US Speaker Pelosi meet amid Ukraine war
189.article_body: US Speaker Nancy Pelosi met German Chancellor Olaf Scholz in Berlin on Friday, with talks centred around the Russia-Ukraine war. "We will persist until the guns are silent," said Pelosi. "It (Ukrainian success) requires substantial security support, humanitarian assistance, economic assistance- and sanctions...that make sure that Russia feels the pain of this," she added.

190.title: I thought Kuldeep could've been picked for WC: Ex-India selector
190.article_body: Former India selector Sarandeep Singh said that spinner Kuldeep Yadav could have been picked in the Indian squad for the upcoming T20 World Cup. "You need a wrist spinner in Australia, but then he (Kuldeep) wasn't really in the scheme of things," Sarandeep said. "[Selectors] didn't want to take any risk, especially after losing in the Asia Cup," he added.

191.title: Shami shouldn't have been left out of T20 WC squad: Sarandeep
191.article_body: Former Indian cricketer Sarandeep Singh said that pacer Mohammad Shami "shouldn't have gone out" from the 15-member squad of the upcoming T20 World Cup in Australia. "The way he (Shami) performed for Gujarat, he should have been there in the main squad. Additionally, what he can do with the new ball, I don't think any other bowler can," Sarandeep said.

192.title: India Maharajas defeat World Giants in match to mark India's 75 years of independence
192.article_body: Harbhajan Singh-led India Maharajas defeated Jacques Kallis-led World Giants by six wickets in a special T20 match to mark India's 75 years of independence. Batting first, World Giants put up a total of 170/8 in their 20 overs, with Kevin O'Brien top-scoring with 52(31). India Maharajas chased down target in 18.4 overs as Tanmay Srivastava and Yusuf Pathan scored fifties.

193.title: Australia had a rule to never sledge Sachin while he's batting: Brett Lee
193.article_body: Former Australian pacer Brett Lee said his team never sledged Sachin Tendulkar as "he will (then) be batting out there forever". "Sachin Tendulkar on the field is completely different...you look into his eyes, the eyes of a tiger. He wants it, wants to get into the battle," said Lee. Sachin has scored 20 centuries in total against the Australians.

194.title: 2 people dead after being hit by train in Kerala
194.article_body: Two people died after a train hit them at the Auvaneeswaram Railway Station near Kollam, Kerala on Friday. The deceased were identified as Sajeena (39) and Rahimkutty (62). The railway station doesn't have a foot overbridge and the deceased died when they were on the track, police said. Notably, Rahimkutty was a local panchayat member.

195.title: Former Lankan Prez Sirisena named suspect in 2019 terror attacks
195.article_body: A court in Sri Lanka on Friday named ex-President Maithripala Sirisena as a suspect in the Easter Sunday terrorist bombings of 2019 which killed 270 people in the country. The Colombo Fort Magistrate's Court said 71-year-old Sirisena had neglected intelligence reports which were presented before the bombings. Sirisena's court appearance is scheduled on October 14.

196.title: Rare deep-sea shark with bulging eyes caught in Australia, pic goes viral
196.article_body: A rare deep-sea shark with bulging eyes was pulled lifeless off the Australian coast by a fisherman. The shark was caught from 2,133 feet underwater. Reacting to shark's viral picture, a social media user wrote, "Stuff of nightmares there." Meanwhile, another user wrote, "Looks really happy he's just had his braces off so is accentuating the gums and teeth."

197.title: Don't become a line-length bowler: Curtly Ambrose to Raj Angad Bawa
197.article_body: All-rounder Raj Angad Bawa revealed that West Indian legend Curtly Ambrose has advised him to not lose his pace. "You can trouble the best...with the kind of steep bounce you generate...Don't become a line-length bowler," Ambrose had told the youngster. Bawa earned his maiden India A call-up for a New Zealand A series starting on September 22 in Chennai.

198.title: Defending champions India lose in SAFF Women's Championship 2022 semis
198.article_body: Defending champions India crashed out of the SAFF Women's Championship 2022 after a 0-1 loss against hosts Nepal in the semi-final in Kathmandu on Friday. Rashmi Kumari Ghising scored the only goal of the game in injury time of the first half. Notably, India have lost in semi-final stage for the first time in the history of the tournament.

199.title: Seems that Congress doesn't need me anymore: 91-yr-old Karan Singh
199.article_body: Veteran Congress leader Karan Singh stated that he has been in the party for his whole life but it seems that it doesn't need him anymore. "I've not been invited for the 'Bharat Jodo Yatra'...Neither I'm on any [Congress] committee...nor has the party consulted me for some years," the 91-year-old added. He said that he feels separated from the party.

200.title: Auto-rickshaw driver stabbed in Gurugram for denying ride
200.article_body: An auto-rickshaw driver was allegedly stabbed by two people in Gurugram after he denied a ride to them, police said on Friday. The victim in his complaint said that the incident took place on Wednesday while he was waiting for passengers at IFFCO Chowk. The victim was stabbed in the shoulder by two drunk youths, as per his complaint.

201.title: Extreme hunger rose 123% in climate change-hit countries: Ofxam
201.article_body: Extreme hunger has increased by 123% in the last six years in countries which are most affected by climate change, Oxfam has reported. It stated that 48 million people in Afghanistan, Burkina Faso, Djibouti, Guatemala, Haiti, Kenya, Madagascar, Niger, Somalia and Zimbabwe have experienced acute hunger. In 2018, 21 million people experienced acute hunger in these countries.

202.title: PSG manager looking to drop one of Messi, Neymar or Mbappe: Report
202.article_body: PSG manager Christophe Galtier is reportedly considering dropping one of Lionel Messi, Neymar or Kylian Mbappe to adjust his tactics. Galtier is reportedly planning to move away from his 3-4-3 formation as he feels its impact has lessened. The manager is said to consider dropping one of the trio for a forward who is willing to hold shape and press.

203.title: Real Madrid looking to organise Nadal-Federer match at Bernabeu: Report
203.article_body: Spanish football club Real Madrid reportedly wants to organise a tennis match between Roger Federer and Rafael Nadal at the Santiago Bernabeu stadium. The arena is currently undergoing renovation and will only fully be ready at the end of 2022. Federer announced his retirement from tennis on Thursday, while Nadal is an honourary member of the La Liga team.

204.title: Nikki Tamboli met Sukesh in jail, received ₹3.5 lakh cash, Gucci bag from him: ED
204.article_body: Television actress Nikki Tamboli's name has come up amid ongoing investigation in the money laundering case against conman Sukesh Chandrasekhar. According to ED, she met Sukesh while he was in jail. Tamboli received ₹3.5 lakh cash and a Gucci bag from Sukesh, ED stated in its chargesheet, obtained by India Today.

205.title: Queen Elizabeth's funeral security may cost ₹60 crore: Ex-royal security officer
205.article_body: Former royal security officer Simon Morgan has predicted that the cost of the security detail for Queen Elizabeth II's funeral will cost more than $7.5 million (around ₹59.76 crore), the New York Post reported. The British Mi5 and Mi6 intelligence agencies will work with London’s Metropolitan Police and Secret Service to secure the VIPs attending the funeral, the report said.

206.title: Never thought I wouldn’t be a part of 'The Kapil Sharma Show' anymore: Ali Asgar
206.article_body: Actor Ali Asgar recently said he never thought he wouldn't be a part of 'The Kapil Sharma Show' anymore. "After the incident (him quitting the show), there has been no communication (with Kapil)," he said. "So it's difficult to say if we would reunite or not...The day something good comes up, we might be together again," Ali added.

207.title: Beckham waits over 12 hrs in line to see Queen Elizabeth's coffin, pics surface
207.article_body: English football icon David Beckham on Friday turned up with thousands of other people standing in queue to see Queen Elizabeth lie-in-state at Westminster Hall in London. Beckham was pictured paying his last respects to the late monarch after waiting in line for over 12 hours. "I was so lucky...to have a few moments...to be around Her Majesty," he said.

208.title: IT park at a cost ₹600 cr to come up in Madurai: TN CM Stalin
208.article_body: Tamil Nadu Chief Minister MK Stalin on Friday announced that an information technology (IT) park would be set up in Madurai at a cost of ₹600 crore. "The park will be set up in two phases in Madurai's downtown Maatuthavani," Stalin stated. He added that the IT park would come up on a five-acre campus in the first phase.

209.title: 15-year-old Pranav Anand becomes India's 76th chess Grandmaster
209.article_body: Pranav Anand has become India's 76th Grandmaster after crossing 2,500 Elo mark in the ongoing World Youth Chess Championship in Mamaia, Romania. The 15-year-old had scored the third and final GM norm at 55th Biel Chess Festival in Switzerland in July. His first two GM norms came in Sitges Open (January 2022) and Vezerkepso GM Round Robin (March 2022) tournaments.

210.title: Sri Lanka announce their squad for T20 World Cup 2022
210.article_body: Asia Cup 2022 champions Sri Lanka on Friday announced their squad for T20 World Cup 2022. Dinesh Chandimal, the veteran middle-order batter, who made a return to the T20I squad in Asia Cup, has been named as a standby player. Sri Lanka also named Dushmantha Chameera and Lahiru Kumara, but their participation will be subject to their fitness.

211.title: Ambulance arrives in middle of ground as Venkatesh Iyer gets hit on head, pic surfaces
211.article_body: During the Duleep Trophy semi-final between Central Zone and West Zone, an ambulance arrived in the middle of the ground after Central Zone's Venkatesh Iyer was hit on the head. West Zone bowler Chintan Gaja picked ball and threw it back at Iyer in anger, after which Iyer went down in pain. However, Iyer preferred to walk off the field.

212.title: Shoaib Akhtar criticises Pakistan's T20 World Cup 2022 squad selection, shares video
212.article_body: Ex-Pakistan fast bowler Shoaib Akhtar criticised Pakistan's T20 World Cup squad selection. In a video, he called Pakistan's chief selector "average", adding that when chief selector would be average, his selection would also be average. He further said that T20I cricket is not Pakistan head coach Saqlain Mushtaq's forte. "I'm really scared as our batting has no depth," Akhtar stated.

213.title: Leonardo DiCaprio is a very nice man: Gigi Hadid's father amid dating rumours
213.article_body: Commenting on his daughter's rumoured relationship with Hollywood actor Leonardo DiCaprio, model Gigi's father Mohamed Hadid said, "They've known each other for some time." "I've not spoken to my daughter about [him]...I don't think they're dating, I believe they're just good friends," he said. Adding that he met DiCaprio a few years ago, Hadid said, "He's a very nice man."

214.title: Thank God Manmohan Singh did not serve over-cooked food like GST: Chidambaram
214.article_body: Congress MP P Chidambaram commented after Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman reportedly said that the 1991 reforms brought in by the then Finance Minister Manmohan Singh were "half-baked". "Thank God, Dr Manmohan Singh did not serve over-cooked and unpalatable food like demonetisation, multiple-rates GST and savage taxes on petrol & diesel," Chidambaram tweeted.

215.title: Shashi's son shares old pic featuring King Charles III on 'Ahista Ahista' set
215.article_body: Late actor Shashi Kapoor's son Kunal Kapoor took to Instagram to share a throwback picture featuring King Charles III. "On the set - 1st schedule of my 1st film Ahista Ahista," he captioned the post. In the picture, King Charles III could be seen posing for the camera, with Kunal smiling behind him. The film was released in 1981.

216.title: We were 20 runs short: Harmanpreet on 7-wicket loss in 3rd T20I vs England
216.article_body: After India Women's seven-wicket defeat against England Women in third and final T20I, India captain Harmanpreet Kaur said her side was 20 runs short. "Credit to our bowlers for keeping us in the game...One needs to have a decent total in any format of the game. We need partnerships with...bat," she added. India lost the T20I series 1-2.

217.title: All Punjab decisions taken by Delhi AAP leaders: Ex-CM Amarinder
217.article_body: Former Punjab CM Captain Amarinder Singh said all state decisions are being taken by either AAP's Raghav Chadha or Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal. "They are not letting poor CM (Bhagwant Mann) function," said Singh, adding that the AAP is making "unnecessary noises" about Operation Lotus to "divert attention". Singh also said he's "101% against" the Agnipath scheme.

218.title: Book 'Modi@20' can be used as management textbook: FM
218.article_body: The book on PM Narendra Modi titled 'Modi@20: Dreams Meet Delivery' can be used as a textbook in management courses, Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said on Thursday. "It's a book which tells how modern-day governance in a complex economy like India can happen," she added. The book is penned by Amit Shah, Anupam Kher, Amish Tripathi and Sadhguru, among others.

219.title: Why create hubbub when nothing to hide: Naqvi on UP madrasa survey
219.article_body: Speaking about the controversy over the ongoing survey of private madrasas by the UP government, senior BJP leader Mukhtar Abbas Naqvi on Friday said, "Why create a hubbub when there is nothing to hide?" Naqvi also said that doubts should not be raised on "all madrasas". The UP government on Monday began surveying "unrecognised" madrasas in the state.

220.title: Turkey to pay for 25% Russian gas supplies in roubles, says Putin
220.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin on Friday said that Russia would soon receive 25% of payment for gas exports to Turkey in roubles. He added that an agreement in this regard would come into force in "the near future". Putin was speaking during a meeting with Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan on the sidelines of the ongoing Shanghai Cooperation Organisation summit.

221.title: Sometimes repeating is closest to reliving: Sara recreates 'Kedarnath' look
221.article_body: Actress Sara Ali Khan took to Instagram on Friday and shared a picture of her recreating her own look from the film 'Kedarnath'. "Decided to repeat my Kedarnath wardrobe. Sometimes repeating is the closest to reliving," she wrote. 'Kedarnath', which also featured late actor Sushant Singh Rajput, marked Sara's acting debut in Bollywood. The film was released in 2018.

222.title: Haaland is the perfect person to manage: Man City manager Guardiola
222.article_body: Manchester City manager Pep Guardiola praised Erling Haaland, saying the 22-year-old is an "exceptional striker" and the "perfect person" to manage. "At the age that he is, his ambition, he wants to be better and will be better," he added. Haaland was named Premier League 'Player of the Month' for August on Friday. Manchester City are currently second in standings.

223.title: Patanjali working on lumpy skin disease solution: Baba Ramdev
223.article_body: Baba Ramdev said his Patanjali Group is working on finding solutions for the lumpy skin disease that has caused the deaths of over 1 lakh cows since July. Ramdev also alleged that the disease might have "come from Pakistan". He added that the disease affected many cows in his shelter house in Haridwar but so far no cow had died.

224.title: Fire breaks out at poha factory in Ujjain; 3 women dead
224.article_body: Three women were charred to death after a fire broke out at Bindal poha factory located in Udyogpuri in Madhya Pradesh's Ujjain on Friday. The women were working inside the factory at the time of the incident. Another woman who was critically injured in the fire was rushed to hospital. The fire brigade reached the spot and controlled the fire.

225.title: Money, power & other means being used to topple govts: NCP chief
225.article_body: NCP chief Sharad Pawar on Thursday criticised the BJP and said that money, power and other means were being used to topple governments in the country. "In Maharashtra, 40 to 50 MLAs defected and the government changed," Pawar said. He further alleged that central probe agencies were being misused to target opposition parties and their leaders.

226.title: Supreme Court gives Centre time till December 15 to implement OROP
226.article_body: Supreme Court has allowed the Centre time till December 15 to implement the One Rank One Pension (OROP) scheme. The Centre had moved an application to extend the June deadline stating that re-fixation of pension is a "time consuming" process. The Centre assured the bench that it was "taking earnest steps" to comply with the order which requires Cabinet approval.

227.title: Cong not doing 'Bharat Jodo', but 'Goonda Jodo Yatra': BJP's Poonawalla
227.article_body: BJP spokesperson Shehzad Poonawalla accused the Congress of engaging goons across the country in the name of 'Bharat Jodo Yatra'. His comment comes after a video surfaced showing local Congress leaders allegedly extorting donations from a vegetable vendor in Kerala's Kollam. "This is not Congress' India Jodo Yatra, but, Goonda Jodo, Recovery Jodo, and Corruption Jodo Yatra," he said.

228.title: NGT orders Rajasthan to pay ₹3,000 cr for improper waste management
228.article_body: The National Green Tribunal (NGT) has directed the Rajasthan government to pay ₹3,000 crore as compensation for improper management of solid and liquid waste. "The compensation had to be equal to the loss to the environment and the cost of remediation," said the bench. It also called for further damage to be prevented and past damage to be "restored".

229.title: Holiday for schools in Puducherry till Sept 25 as fever cases spike
229.article_body: A holiday has been declared for all schools in Puducherry and Karaikal for classes 1-8 from September 17-25 following a "sudden spike in fever cases among children", the Puducherry government announced on Friday. The decision was taken considering the well-being of the children and on the directions of the Union Territory's Chief Minister N Rangasamy and Education Minister A Namassivayam.

230.title: Malaika Arora & Amrita Arora to do a series titled 'Arora Sisters': Report
230.article_body: Malaika Arora and her actress-sister Amrita Arora are set to appear in a series titled 'Arora Sisters', according to a report. The upcoming web series will focus on the personal and professional lives of the siblings, the report said. "The show will also feature Amrita and Malaika's inner circle of folks and friends," a source quoted by Pinkvilla said.

231.title: Broadest mobilisation of secular forces needed to defeat Hindutva: CPI(M)
231.article_body: The CPI(M) said that the "broadest mobilisation of secular forces is needed to defeat Hindutva communalism". In a communique, the Polit Bureau of the CPI(M) stated, "The CPI(M) will work to develop its independent strength, strengthen Left unity, forge unity of Left & Democratic forces." It added, "BJP's claim of any role in forcing Nizam's surrender [of Hyderabad] is farcical."

232.title: Bahrain confirms first case of monkeypox in 29-year-old expatriate
232.article_body: Bahrain has reported its first confirmed case of monkeypox, the country's state news agency BNA reported on Friday citing the health ministry. The infection was detected in a 29-year-old male expatriate, as per BNA's report. Bahrain's health ministry said that the man was returning from abroad when his symptoms were suspected and diagnosed, the report added.

233.title: Maha man puts daughter's body in salt pit after alleged rape, seeks 2nd autopsy
233.article_body: The body of a woman was preserved in a salt pit for 44 days in Maharashtra's Nandurbar by her father, who alleged that she had been gang-raped and murdered, a police officer said. The man had demanded that a second post-mortem be conducted on her. According to police, three persons have been arrested in connection with the case.

234.title: He came, we saw, he conquered, we admired: Tsitsipas on Federer's retirement
234.article_body: Paying tribute to Roger Federer after he announced his retirement, world number six Stefanos Tsitsipas took to Instagram and wrote, "He came. We saw. He conquered. We admired. Thank you Roger Federer for elevating our sport to an unfathomable extent." He added, "I can't thank you enough for being the reason I pursued tennis in the first place."

235.title: Siddique Kappan is my best friend, our kids are proud of him: Wife
235.article_body: Journalist Siddique Kappan's wife on Friday stated that their children are very proud of Siddique and are "broken" seeing how he has been subjected to torture. Raihanath claimed that her daughter, who wanted to become a teacher, now wants to become an advocate to fight for her father and people like him. She also called her husband her best friend.

236.title: Will soon bring a right to health bill: Rajasthan CM
236.article_body: Rajasthan Chief Minister Ashok Gehlot on Friday said that his government will soon bring a right to health bill. "I hope that soon this bill will be passed so that people get their rights," he added. Mentioning the old pension scheme and the separate budget for farmers, he claimed that his government's schemes have been "brilliant" so far.

237.title: Vinesh reveals facing period cramps at World C'ships, says 'Tried period-stopping tablets'
237.article_body: Wrestler Vinesh Phogat, who recently created history by becoming the first Indian woman to win multiple medals at World Championships, revealed she battled period cramps during the World Championships in Belgrade. "I tried period-stopping tablets for the first time, but it happened at Dubai [during transit], and I thought all...hard work of the past 10 months is gone," she said.

238.title: What is Roger Federer's record against rivals Rafael Nadal and Novak Djokovic?
238.article_body: Roger Federer and Rafael Nadal played 40 matches together, with Federer winning 16 and Nadal winning 24. Their first match against each other took place in 2004 at Miami, which Nadal won, while their last match was at Wimbledon 2019, which Federer won. Federer and Novak Djokovic played against each other 50 times, with Djokovic winning 27 and Federer 23.

239.title: If picked, Ashwin will know how to perform in T20 WC in Australia: Vettori
239.article_body: Ex-New Zealand captain Daniel Vettori said all-rounder Ravichandran Ashwin, who has been included in India's 15-member squad for T20 World Cup 2022, will know how to perform in Australia if he's picked in the playing XI. "He's one of those guys who's very adaptable...understands what he needs to do in all situations...He's been to Australia on a number of occasions."

240.title: K'taka to launch 15-day health campaign on PM Modi's birthday
240.article_body: Karnataka Health Minister K Sudhakar on Friday said the state will launch a 15-day health campaign on PM Narendra Modi's birthday on Saturday. CM Basavaraj Bommai will inaugurate the campaign at Bangalore Medical College and Research Institute, he added. He stated that health parameters will be screened at healthcare facilities during the campaign, which aims to create awareness among people.

241.title: Was sexually assaulted by 10-15 men daily: 14-yr-old girl who worked at Gurugram spa
241.article_body: A 14-year-old girl who worked as a receptionist at a Gurugram spa alleged that she was raped and forced into prostitution by the spa's operator and her aides. "On any given day...10-15 men would assault me," the girl told police. The accused allegedly filmed the first sexual assault and threatened the girl so that she would continue to work there.

242.title: If Disha Vakani doesn't come back, we'll get a new actor: 'Taarak...' producer
242.article_body: 'Taarak Mehta Ka Ooltah Chashmah' producer Asit Kumarr Modi spoke about Disha Vakani's absence from the show and said if she doesn't come back, he'll get a new actor to play the role of  Daya. Disha took a maternity break in 2017 after delivering a baby girl. "I...waited for her during...pandemic and I'm waiting for her even today," said Asit.

243.title: Extinct prehistoric reptile that lived among dinosaurs discovered in US
243.article_body: The well-preserved fossil of a new extinct species of a lizard-like reptile that lived amongst dinosaurs has been discovered in Wyoming's Morrison Formation in the US. Named Opisthiamimus gregori, the species inhabited Jurassic North America around 150 million years ago. It measured about 6 inches from nose to tail, and likely survived on a diet of insects and small invertebrates.

244.title: I think Anderson-Broad is best attack in world: Ex-English seamer
244.article_body: Former English seamer Tim Bresnan said that the bowling duo of James Anderson and Stuart Broad is the "best bowling attack at the moment" across all conditions. "They came out on top [against South Africa] so you got to say they are the best," Bresnan said. He added, "Hopefully Anderson plays for as long as he wants."

245.title: Haven't levelled personal allegations against Sharad Pawar: Maha BJP chief
245.article_body: Maharashtra BJP chief Chandrashekhar Bawankule on Friday said he had not levelled any personal allegation against NCP chief Sharad Pawar. "We're strengthening our party through our works," Bawankule said. "My statement on finishing off NCP in Baramati was taken as a personal allegation by Pawar," he added. Bawankule's statement had invited a sharp rebuke from the NCP.

246.title: AAP MLA Amanatullah Khan arrested in Waqf board corruption case
246.article_body: The Delhi Police's Anti-Corruption Branch (ACB) on Friday arrested AAP MLA Amanatullah Khan after questioning him for hours in connection with a corruption case involving the Delhi Waqf Board. The arrest came after the ACB found incriminating material and evidence against Khan during searches conducted earlier in the day on the premises of the MLA and his aide.

247.title: Create portal for Ukraine-return medical students: SC to Centre
247.article_body: The Supreme Court on Friday suggested the Centre create a web portal to help medical students, who returned from Ukraine, complete their courses in alternate foreign universities. It said the portal must mention fees and the number of seats available in universities. Earlier, the Centre said the students cannot be accommodated in Indian colleges due to a lack of provisions.

248.title: He's got to mature a bit more: Tim Bresnan on Hardik Pandya
248.article_body: Former English seamer Tim Bresnan said that Indian all-rounder Hardik Pandya "got to mature a bit more" in order to become a "top player". Speaking about various teams' chances to win the upcoming T20 World Cup, Bresnan said, "I think England, Australia and New Zealand are probably the three favourites. But India and Pakistan have the same chance."

249.title: Will be cheering for India: IM Vijayan ahead of U-17 Women's World Cup
249.article_body: Ahead of FIFA Under-17 Women's World Cup, ex-Indian football player IM Vijayan said it's a great opportunity for the Indian team and there's absolutely no pressure on them. "This is the best age to play against some of the top teams like Brazil...USA...I for one will certainly be cheering them on," he added. World Cup will be held in India.

250.title: Begusarai shooting a terror attack, NIA or CBI must probe: BJP leader Giriraj Singh
250.article_body: Calling the Begusarai mass shooting incident a "terrorist attack", Union Minister and senior BJP leader Giriraj Singh on Friday demanded that the National Investigation Agency (NIA) or Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) must probe the matter. He also criticised the Nitish Kumar-led Bihar government and said the incident has exposed the face of the ruling regime.

251.title: PM Modi, Turkish Prez Erdogan discuss bilateral ties in Samarkand
251.article_body: PM Narendra Modi and Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan met in Samarkand, Uzbekistan, on Friday. The two leaders, who are participating in the Shanghai Cooperation Organisation (SCO) Summit in Uzbekistan, reviewed bilateral ties and discussed ways to enhance cooperation. Ministry of External Affairs Spokesperson Arindam Bagchi said the leaders "appreciated recent gains in bilateral trade".

252.title: 9 killed, 20 injured in stampede at concert in Guatemala
252.article_body: At least nine people were killed and nearly 20 were injured after a stampede broke out at a concert venue in Guatemala on Thursday as the country celebrated its independence day, according to rescuers. The stampede reportedly occurred at one of the exits of the fairground where the concert was held. The incident happened towards the end of the concert.

253.title: Milind Soman buys ₹6.8 crore sea-facing 4 BHK apartment in Mumbai, pics surface
253.article_body: Actor-model Milind Soman has bought a new sea-facing home worth around ₹6.8 crore in Mumbai's Prabhadevi area. According to reports, Milind's new property is in a standalone tower Ocean Star. The 4 BHK apartment reportedly has a carpet area of 1,720 sq ft and comes with two parking slots. It offers views of the Arabian Sea and Bandra Worli Sea-Link.

254.title: Video shows all of Roger Federer's 103 trophy lifts
254.article_body: Roger Federer, who announced his retirement on Thursday, won 103 singles titles. The 41-year-old bagged his first ATP title win in 2001 at Milan. His most successful calendar year was 2006 during which he won 12 titles. He holds records for most titles at Basel (10), Halle (10), Wimbledon (8), ATP Masters 1000 Cincinnati (7) and Nitto ATP Finals (6).

255.title: Kerala man carrying gun escorts girl students amid stray dog menace
255.article_body: A video of a man carrying an air gun and leading a group of girl students to a local madrasa in Kerala's Kasargod has surfaced online. He said he decided to accompany the children, including his daughter, to draw the attention of authorities on stray dog menace. He added that he would shoot the dogs if they attacked the children.

256.title: Former Gujarat CM Shankersinh Vaghela meets Telangana CM KCR
256.article_body: Former Gujarat CM Shankersinh Vaghela met Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao in Hyderabad on Friday. "We had [a] fruitful meeting where we discussed the national political issues," Vaghela tweeted. The meeting of the two senior leaders comes after KCR's office recently stated that the formation of a national party and formulation of its policies will take place soon.

257.title: RSS, BJP giving communal colour to Lakhimpur Kheri incident: Cong
257.article_body: The Congress on Friday accused BJP and RSS of giving a communal colour to the alleged rape and murder of two Dalit sisters in Uttar Pradesh's Lakhimpur Kheri. They demanded that justice delivery in the case be fast-tracked. Congress' Rajesh Lilothia said the incident should not be seen as an isolated incident and alleged that atrocities against Dalits are rising.

258.title: It's hard to see this day: Novak Djokovic on Roger Federer's retirement
258.article_body: Novak Djokovic took to Instagram to pen a note on Roger Federer's retirement. He wrote, "Roger...it's hard to see this day and put into words all...we've shared in this sport together." He added, "It's an honour to know you on and off court...and for many more years to come. I know...this new chapter will hold amazing things for you."

259.title: PCB responds to Shahid Afridi's allegations over Shaheen Afridi’s treatment
259.article_body: After Shahid Afridi claimed PCB isn't doing anything for Shaheen Afridi's treatment and Shaheen is spending his own money, PCB said, "He's making excellent progress in...London...He's on track to make...full recovery...for...T20 World Cup." It added, "It goes without saying...PCB has always been and will continue to be responsible for arranging medical care and rehabilitation of...its players."

260.title: Variety predicts 2 Oscar nominations for RRR, including Best Int'l Film
260.article_body: American media company Variety has published its list of potential Oscar nominees in various categories and SS Rajamouli's 'RRR' has featured in two of them. The publication has predicted that 'RRR' will be nominated for its song 'Dosti' in the Best Original Song category. 'RRR' is also predicted to get nominated for the Best International Feature Film.

261.title: 2 clerics, 5 members of banned JeI arrested under PSA in J&K
261.article_body: Two Islamic clerics and five members of the banned Jamaat-e-Islami (JeI) have been arrested in Jammu & Kashmir (J&K) under the Public Safety Act (PSA), police said. The two clerics, Abdul Rashid Dawoodi and Mushtaq Ahmad Veeri, have a significant following on social media. Those arrested under the PSA can be detained for up to two years.

262.title: SCO must create resilient supply chain in our region: PM amid Ukraine war
262.article_body: Addressing a session of the SCO summit in Uzbekistan, PM Narendra Modi said on Friday that the SCO should create "resilient and diversified supply chains" in the region. "The pandemic and the crisis in Ukraine caused many obstacles in global supply chains, due to which the whole world is facing an unprecedented energy and food crisis," he further said.

263.title: Mukesh Ambani makes ₹1.5 cr offering at Lord Venkateshwara shrine in Andhra: Report
263.article_body: Billionaire Reliance Industries Limited Chairman Mukesh Ambani on Friday handed over a cheque for ₹1.5 crore to the ancient Lord Venkateshwara hill shrine in Andhra Pradesh, PTI reported. A Tirumala Tirupati Devasthanams (TTD) official told PTI that Ambani visited the shrine on Friday with his son Anant Ambani's fiancée Radhika Merchant. Ambani also performed Abhishekam ritual there, PTI said.

264.title: Tamil Nadu pastor arrested for raping, impregnating minor girl
264.article_body: After absconding for around 1.5 years, a Tamil Nadu-based pastor was finally arrested for allegedly raping and impregnating a minor girl. The accused, Prince Charles (59), was arrested along with his 29-year-old son for allegedly raping the minor, who delivered a baby in 2020, police said. Notably, the crime was allegedly committed at a children's home in Vayalur, Tiruvallur.

265.title: Rajasthan HC's Justice Rameshwar Vyas tenders resignation
265.article_body: Justice Rameshwar Vyas, a Rajasthan High Court judge, has tendered his resignation, which took effect from August 31, 2022. Vyas was due for superannuation on September 10. “Shri Justice Rameshwar Vyas has tendered his resignation...in pursuance of proviso (a) to clause (1) of Article 217 of the Constitution, with effect from 31.08.2022 afternoon,” read a government notification.

266.title: Indian Coast Guard rescues 19 persons from sinking ship near Ratnagiri
266.article_body: Indian Coast Guard carried out a rescue operation at Motor Tanker Parth, which was sinking near Maharashtra's Ratnagiri on Friday. They saved 19 persons, including 18 Indians and an Ethiopian Master, from the ship. The Gabon-flagged vessel was on its way to New Mangalore from UAE. It reported flooding at about 9:23 am, following which rescue teams were sent immediately.

267.title: Want to transform India into a manufacturing hub: PM at SCO summit
267.article_body: Speaking at the SCO summit in Uzbekistan, PM Narendra Modi on Friday said that the Centre is working on transforming India into a manufacturing hub. "We're supporting innovation in every sector. Today, there are [over] 70,000 startups in India," he said. India is ready to set up 'Special Working Group' to coordinate with SCO nations on innovation technology, he added.

268.title: Mom had said 'Woh kabhi picture nahi bana sakta': Gauri on Karan Johar
268.article_body: Gauri Khan revealed on 'Fabulous Lives of Bollywood Wives' that her mother wasn't happy with Karan Johar directing Shah Rukh Khan in 'Kuch Kuch Hota Hai'. "I told mom Shah Rukh is shooting for Karan's film...She reacted, 'Bilkul nahi, woh kabhi picture nahi bana sakta (He can never make a film).' Only...one person...knew he's...genius," Gauri said pointing at herself.

269.title: Delhi teacher beats security guard in school campus; video surfaces
269.article_body: A video purportedly showing a teacher of a government school in Delhi beating a security guard on the school premises has surfaced online. According to police, both the teacher and the security guard filed a complaint two days after the incident. Police have asked them to give their written statement.

270.title: Guj MLA Mevani, 18 others sentenced to 6-month jail in 2016 rioting case
270.article_body: A court in Gujarat's Ahmedabad on Friday sentenced MLA Jignesh Mevani and 18 others to six-month simple imprisonment in a case of rioting and unlawful assembly in 2016. The case was related to a road blockade agitation staged by Mevani and his associates. Mevani had organised the protest to rename Gujarat University's Law Bhavan building after Dr BR Ambedkar.

271.title: Punjab man, brother kill neighbour who stopped man from hitting wife
271.article_body: A man and his brother have been booked in Punjab's Ludhiana for murdering their neighbour who tried to stop the man from beating his wife. The victim was killed when he again intervened as the accused beat his father-in-law. The victim's wife filed the complaint alleging that her husband was killed by the duo with an iron rod.

272.title: Man City's Haaland wins Premier League 'Player of the Month' for August
272.article_body: Manchester City forward Erling Haaland has been named Premier League's 'Player of the Month' for August. The 22-year-old scored nine goals in his opening five matches in August before making that 10 in six in early September. "I'm delighted to win this award for the first time- it was an incredible start of the season for the team," said Haaland.

273.title: Show 56-inch chest to China or surrender: Swamy to PM Modi
273.article_body: Former BJP MP Subramanian Swamy has told PM Narendra Modi to "demonstrate" his '56-inch chest' by telling China to "get PLA out of Indian territory". Swamy said if PM Modi couldn't do this, then he should "surrender to China...as per Adani's advice". Earlier, Swamy said he was "two steps away" from being in the "same situation" as Haren Pandya.

274.title: 'Can't offer birthday wishes to you in advance,' says Putin to PM Modi; video surfaces
274.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin on Friday told PM Narendra Modi, "I know that tomorrow, my dear friend, you're about to celebrate your birthday." Putin continued, "As per Russian tradition, we never offer congratulations in advance. So I cannot do that right now." Speaking in Uzbekistan, the Russian President told PM, "We wish you all the best...we wish prosperity to India."

275.title: Babar should use his feet against fast bowlers: Herschelle Gibbs
275.article_body: Former South African batter Herschelle Gibbs said that if Pakistan skipper Babar Azam "adds one or two more attacking options to his game" then the latter's "strike rate will improve and be even more effective". "Using his feet to the quicks to disrupt their lengths and slog sweeping the spinners. Those are two low-risk shots but effective," Gibbs tweeted.

276.title: BJP destroying democracy with Operation Lotus: Ex-BJP MP Sushant
276.article_body: Former MP from Himachal Pradhesh's Kangra, Dr Rajan Sushant, said his former party, the BJP, is "destroying democracy by indulging in horse-trading under Operation Lotus". "If it succeeds, we would be in an East India Company rule kind of situation in the long term," he said. Sushant said the BJP was taking the country to "an Emergency-like situation of 1975".

277.title: 1 killed in Kherson in Ukrainian strike: Pro-Russia official
277.article_body: At least one person was killed and several others were injured after Ukrainian forces bombarded government buildings in the Russian-controlled Kherson city on Friday, the Russian-installed deputy head of the Kherson region said. The official also claimed that US-made HIMARS rockets were used in the strike. Russia seized control of the Kherson region shortly after invading Ukraine in February.

278.title: UP woman allegedly held captive for 8 days & raped, FIR filed
278.article_body: Police in UP's Pilibhit filed a case against a man who allegedly kept a woman captive for eight days and raped her after the survivor approached a local court. As per a police official, the woman said the man "seduced" her. The man and woman reportedly knew each other and she was saved from captivity by her mother.

279.title: IndiGo flight makes emergency landing at Kanpur airport due to technical snag
279.article_body: An Indore-bound IndiGo flight was grounded at Kanpur airport following a technical snag, the airlines stated, as reported by ANI. An alternate aircraft was also reportedly arranged by IndiGo for the passengers. In another such incident, an IndiGo flight from Bhopal to Mumbai was also grounded earlier this month due to a technical glitch, the Airports Authority of India stated.

280.title: It's been a privilege to witness your career: World no. 1 Swiatek to Federer
280.article_body: Reacting to Roger Federer's retirement news, world number one Iga Swiatek took to Twitter and wrote, "I just want to thank you for everything you've done and everything you are for our sport." She added, "It's been a privilege to witness your career. I wish you all the best." The 20-time Grand Slam champion last played at Wimbledon 2021.

281.title: AIADMK holds state-wide protest against power tariff hike in TN
281.article_body: AIADMK, the Opposition party in Tamil Nadu, on Friday staged a state-wide protest against the power tariff hike by the ruling DMK government. AIADMK leaders raised slogans, urging the state government to roll back the hike. "With a constant annual hike, the prices by 2026 will have increased by 30% and will affect the public," AIADMK's Edappadi K Palaniswami said.

282.title: India facing highest unemployment rate in last 45 years: Rahul Gandhi
282.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi, who is on 'Bharat Jodo Yatra', on Friday said India is facing the highest unemployment rate in the last 45 years. "Educated youngsters are wandering in search of employment," he said. "I'm meeting...many youngsters during our Bharat Jodo trip, understanding their expectations from the government...and how many more possibilities can we create for them," he said.

283.title: 5-yr-old becomes India's youngest to undergo en-bloc kidney transplant
283.article_body: A 5-year-old boy from Haryana has become the youngest Indian to undergo en-bloc kidney transplant surgery in the country at All India Institute of Medical Sciences (AIIMS), Delhi. The donor of the kidneys was a 16-month-old baby who was declared brain dead. The recipient was suffering from an autoimmune disease that affected both his kidneys, Dr Manjunath Maruti Pol said.

284.title: The current era is not an era of war: PM Modi to Russian Prez on Ukraine war
284.article_body: PM Narendra Modi today told Russian President Vladimir Putin that the 'current era is not one of war'. "I've spoken to you about it on the call. Today we'll get the opportunity to talk about how can we progress on the path of peace," said PM to Putin in Uzbekistan. This is their first meeting since the Ukraine war began.

285.title: Nadiadwala's film on 'Mahabharat' to release in 20 languages: Report
285.article_body: Producer Firoz Nadiadwala's upcoming film on 'Mahabharat' will reportedly be released in 20 languages. As per a source quoted by Pinkvilla, it will release in 15 international languages, including English, Thai, Mandarin, Russian, Japanese, African, Arabic, Korean, Cantonese and Malaysian among others. The film will reportedly also release in Hindi, Tamil, Telugu, Malayalam and Kannada.

286.title: Blue light from phones may lead to earlier onset of puberty: Study
286.article_body: As per research, blue light from phones and tablets may lead to earlier onset of puberty in children. Melatonin is a hormone that helps control the sleep cycle and is associated with delaying the start of puberty in children. Its levels drop naturally as children grow up. But the blue light suppresses the level of melatonin, resulting in early puberty.

287.title: Restaurant's Muslim manager arrested for preserving raw cow meat in Surat
287.article_body: A Muslim manager of a restaurant, Delhi Dastarkhwan, in Surat was arrested for allegedly preserving raw cow meat in the restaurant's freezer. However, the accused, Sarfaraz Khan, claimed it to be buffalo meat. Meanwhile, the Forensic Science Laboratory's report mentioned that out of the six samples, two samples were cow meat while others were buffalo meat, police said.

288.title: 2 arrested from Haryana's Hisar for GST fraud of around ₹75 cr
288.article_body: Police arrested two people from Haryana's Hisar for allegedly evading goods and services tax of about ₹75 crore. The accused, Shubham and Deepanshu, were involved in creating fake firms and invoices, a police spokesperson said. "Police...recovered PAN cards, Aadhar Cards...two laptops, mobile phones, note-counting machine, blank cheques and a hard disk from the...accused," the spokesperson added.

289.title: Will beautify Delhi if get control of MCD: CM Arvind Kejriwal
289.article_body: Accusing the current MCD of trying to turn Delhi into a city of "garbage mountains", CM Arvind Kejriwal said if AAP gets control of the MCD, it'll beautify the national capital. "The government is working to make Delhi a City of Tirangas, lakes and parks and these people want to turn it into a city of garbage mountains," he added.

290.title: PM Modi true follower of BR Ambedkar: Former President Kovind
290.article_body: Former President Ram Nath Kovind on Friday said PM Narendra Modi is a true follower of BR Ambedkar and is working towards turning the social reformer's vision into reality. "As Babasaheb had said we are Indians first, Indians later and Indians till the end, PM Modi also says India first," Kovind said. PM Modi is vindicating Babasaheb's vision, he added.

291.title: We know your concerns on Ukraine war, want it to end soon: Putin to PM Modi
291.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin on Friday told PM Narendra Modi that Russia knew about India's stand and "concerns" on the conflict in Ukraine. "We want all of this to end as soon as possible," Putin told PM Modi on the sidelines of the Shanghai Cooperation Organisation (SCO) summit in Uzbekistan. "We'll keep you abreast of what's happening there," said Putin.

292.title: I save screenshots of posts that make personal attacks: Dulquer
292.article_body: Actor Dulquer Salmaan said in an interview that he saves screenshots of social media posts that make personal attacks. "If you search...my phone, you'll find screenshots of comments that personally attack me. I...even look at them from time to time," Dulquer said, adding, "Twitter, Instagram, YouTube, (I save them all). I remember the IDs of all those who attack me."

293.title: Reply to PIL on reduced hours in govt schools: HC to Delhi govt
293.article_body: The High Court has asked the Delhi government to respond to Public Interest Litigation (PIL) which alleged government schools in the city's northeast were conducting classes either on alternate days or for reduced hours. The pleas said classes were being held irregularly due to a lack of infrastructure. The court asked the government to respond in three weeks.

294.title: AAP MLA Amanatullah Khan raided by ACB in Waqf board corruption case
294.article_body: The Delhi Police's Anti-Corruption Branch (ACB) on Friday raided AAP MLA Amanatullah Khan's house and five other locations linked to him in a two-year-old corruption case involving the Delhi Waqf Board. As per reports, an unlicensed weapon and cash worth ₹12 lakh were seized from an aide of the MLA. Khan was called for questioning on Friday at 12 pm.

295.title: Irfan Pathan names his India playing XI for T20 World Cup 2022
295.article_body: Ex-Team India all-rounder Irfan Pathan has named his Team India playing XI for T20 World Cup 2022, which will begin in Australia next month. Irfan named Rohit Sharma and KL Rahul as his openers. Other players in the playing XI include Virat Kohli, Suryakumar Yadav, Deepak Hooda, Hardik Pandya, Dinesh Karthik, Harshal Patel, Bhuvneshwar Kumar, Jasprit Bumrah and Yuzvendra Chahal

296.title: Who is invited and who is not to Queen Elizabeth's funeral?
296.article_body: Japan's Emperor Naruhito and Empress Masako will come for Queen Elizabeth II's funeral. Dutch King Willem-Alexander, King Philippe of Belgium, King Harald V of Norway will also attend. Among global leaders, US President Joe Biden and French President Emmanuel Macron will attend the funeral. Russia and Belarus will be excluded, along with Myanmar and North Korea, said reports.

297.title: Clean buses & maintain punctuality: PMPML passengers in survey
297.article_body: Dirty buses, non-maintenance of punctuality and dilapidated bus stops are the main criticisms the Pune Mahanagar Parivahan Mahamandal Limited (PMPML) has received in a survey it conducted among 2 lakh passengers. Among the replies, 69,252 were positive, 861 were negative and 55,454 made suggestions. The suggestions included restarting the ₹70-bus passes and launching a PMPML application.

298.title: Delhi records 8th monkeypox case as Nigerian woman tests positive
298.article_body: A 30-year-old Nigerian woman has tested positive for monkeypox in Delhi, becoming the city's eighth case of the disease and the 13th case across India. The woman is currently admitted to Lok Nayak Jai Prakash Narayan (LNJP) Hospital. Monkeypox is a zoonotic viral disease which causes symptoms such as skin lesions, headache, fever, muscle aches and sore throat.

299.title: 50-yr-old man sodomises 12-yr-old UP boy, tries to kill him; arrested
299.article_body: A 50-year-old man has been arrested for sodomising a 12-year-old boy in a village in Uttar Pradesh. The boy was reportedly playing outside his house when Brahma Nand persuaded him to accompany him to a nearby field. After sodomising him, Nand tried to kill the boy by tying a rope around his neck. However, the boy managed to escape.

300.title: Harassment by loan apps rose 376% after pandemic: Pune Police
300.article_body: Complaints of harassment against persons running instant loan applications have increased by 376% after the COVID-19 pandemic, stated Pune Police's Cyber Cell. In 2019, police received 322 such complaints. The number rose to 837 complaints in 2020, then 928 in 2021 and 3,151 in 2022. Cyber cell Inspector Kumar Ghadge said these applications do not follow regular banking procedures.

301.title: Gang that sold cooking gas for commercial purposes busted in Mumbai
301.article_body: The Mumbai Police have busted a gang that used to convert LPG cylinders meant for household use under government subsidies, into commercial cylinders, by registering as fake consumers with gas agencies. The police arrested three accused, Trimuthi Tirumal (35), Mangilal Bisnoi (32) and Shravan Bisnoi (35), from a godown in Malwani and recovered 194 LPG cylinders.

302.title: Babar would've gotten lot of support if Malik was in Pak's T20 WC team: Afridi
302.article_body: Following Shoaib Malik's exclusion from Pakistan's 15-member squad for next month's T20 World Cup 2022, Shahid Afridi said the all-rounder deserves to be part of the squad. "He is a top choice for every franchise...[Captain] Babar Azam would have gotten a lot of support if Malik had been there, even if he was on the bench," he added.

303.title: Who is Pinky Irani, the woman who put Sukesh Chandrasekhar in touch with actors, models?
303.article_body: Pinky Irani, who was questioned in the money laundering case involving Sukesh Chandrasekhar, has been described as a "personal shopper" for actresses, including Jacqueline Fernandez. According to police, she was an anchor and is "well-connected" in entertainment industry. She'd allegedly ask actors and models to meet Sukesh or talk to him, and buy expensive gifts for them from his money.

304.title: Chinese officials banned from viewing Queen Elizabeth's coffin in UK: Reports
304.article_body: Chinese government officials who will visit the UK for Queen Elizabeth's funeral have been banned from viewing the late monarch as she lies-in-state at Westminster Hall, reports said on Friday. The delegation has been blocked from the vigil over sanctions imposed on British parliamentarians for criticising alleged human rights violations in Xinjiang. Five British MPs were sanctioned by Beijing.

305.title: No way to repay what SRK has done on Brahmastra: Ayan Mukerji
305.article_body: 'Brahmastra' director Ayan Mukerji in an interview said, "There is no way to ever repay what Shah Rukh Khan has done on Brahmastra." "Unanimously, one of the favourite things in Brahmastra has been Shah Rukh sir's sequence," he added. Shah Rukh played the role of scientist Mohan Bhargav in the film.

306.title: Fatal road crashes in Delhi rose by 3.6% in 2021: Report
306.article_body: Fatal road crashes in Delhi went up by 3.6% in 2021 as compared to 2020, whereas total crashes rose by 13%, as per a report released by Delhi Police. The national capital witnessed 4,720 road crashes in 2021 in which 1,239 people lost their lives, the report added. Around 40.7% of the total persons killed in road crashes were pedestrians.

307.title: Mumbai man arrested for killing wife, dumping her headless body in creek
307.article_body: A 32-year-old man from Mumbai's Nalasopara has been arrested for allegedly killing his wife and dumping her headless body in creek last year in Palghar. This year on August 29, the woman's grandmother approached police stating the woman had been missing for a year. Upon investigation, police found that her husband, who was suspicious of her character, had killed her.

308.title: US chess player accused of using sex toy to win against Magnus Carlsen, denies claims
308.article_body: A 19-year-old grandmaster has been accused of cheating to win a September 4 match against World Number one chess player Magnus Carlsen. American Hans Niemann denied online allegations that he used anal beads (a type of sex toy) that would vibrate and tell him about the best moves. "If they want me to strip naked, I'll do it," said Niemann.

309.title: TDP MLAs protest near Speaker's chair, suspended from Andhra Assembly
309.article_body: Andhra Pradesh Assembly Speaker Tammineni Seetharam suspended 13 Telugu Desam Party (TDP) MLAs from the Assembly on Friday. The MLAs, who had surrounded Seetharam's chair and raised slogans, were evicted from the House by marshals. They wanted a discussion on rising prices by adjourning other items on the agenda. Notably, 16 TDP MLAs were suspended from the Assembly on Thursday.

310.title: Fertiliser crisis in Bihar artificial: Union Minister Bhagwanth Khuba
310.article_body: Union Minister of State for Chemicals and Fertilisers Bhagwanth Khuba accused the Nitish Kumar government of creating an artificial fertiliser crisis in Bihar despite adequate supply from the central government. "I urge...farmers not to pay even a penny extra, as the Narendra Modi government is giving heavy subsidies on urea, DAP, NPK, etc for the benefit of farmers," Khuba added.

311.title: My relations with Congress are almost zero: Veteran leader Karan Singh
311.article_body: Veteran Congress leader Karan Singh showed disappointment towards party functionaries and said that his relations with the grand old party are almost zero. Sharing that he was dropped from the working committee, he said, "Yes, I'm in Congress but there's no contact, nobody asks me anything. I do my own work. My relations with the party are almost zero now."

312.title: 51-yr-old Mumbai civic official loses ₹81,500 online while seeking refund
312.article_body: A 51-year-old civic official from Mumbai was cheated of ₹81,500 in a cyber fraud while trying to receive a refund after returning the headphones he had purchased online. According to police, a person claiming to be an executive from the e-shopping portal asked the complainant to download a remote access app on his phone and siphoned ₹81,500 from his account.

313.title: At least 8 killed as flash floods hit central Italy
313.article_body: At least eight people have been killed by torrential overnight rains and floods in Italy's Marche region, authorities said. Around 400 millimetres of rain fell within two to three hours, inundating the streets of several towns around the region's capital Ancona. "We were given a normal alert for rain, but nobody had expected anything like this," an official said.

314.title: Jadeja would have added more value in India's T20 WC squad: Prasad
314.article_body: Talking about India's squad for upcoming T20 World Cup 2022, ex-India pacer Venkatesh Prasad said it's a balanced squad. "It has amazing batters and all-rounders. Ravindra Jadeja has missed out but would have added more value. Bowling looks very good. There are a lot of variations," he added. Jadeja was ruled out of the squad after undergoing knee surgery.

315.title: CBI team reaches Goa to investigate Sonali Phogat death case
315.article_body: A CBI team from Delhi has reached Goa to investigate the alleged murder case of actor Sonali Phogat. The Home Ministry had referred the case to the CBI after Goa Chief Minister Pramod Sawant wrote to the Union Home Minister Amit Shah, requesting a probe by the CBI. Police has so far arrested five people in connection with the case.

316.title: CSB Bank’s stock hits 6-month high after appointing Pralay Mondal as CEO & MD
316.article_body: A day after CSB Bank Limited announced the appointment of Pralay Mondal as the Managing Director and CEO, shares of the Kerala-based private lender hit a six-month high on Friday. At 2:20 pm, its shares were trading at a 2.55% high of ₹235.05 apiece on the NSE. Mondal has been appointed for a period of three years following RBI's approval.

317.title: Jharkhand CM meets Governor, asks for clarity on EC’s disqualification opinion
317.article_body: Jharkhand CM Hemant Soren met Governor Ramesh Bais and demanded a copy of the recommendation sent by Election Commission in the office of profit case. He also urged him to clear the confusion prevailing in the state over his continuation as an MLA. He alleged that the BJP is trying to destabilise his government by talking about the case.

318.title: Patanjali will launch 4 IPOs in next 5 years: Baba Ramdev
318.article_body: Yoga guru Baba Ramdev announced the initial public offering plans for four Patanjali Group companies over next five years. The companies expected to be listed on the stock market are Patanjali Ayurved, Patanjali Wellness, Patanjali Medicine and Patanjali Lifestyle. He also said that "the action plan" is "to achieve the target of ₹5 lakh crore market value in coming years".

319.title: Harsha Engineers IPO subscribed 74.6 times on 3rd and final day
319.article_body: The initial public offering of Harsha Engineers International was subscribed 74.6 times with bids for 125 crore equity shares against the offer size of 1.68 crore shares on Friday, the final day of bidding. Non-institutional investors subscribed 71.3 times, followed by retail investors subscribing 17.5 times the portion set aside for them. Qualified institutional buyers subscribed 178.26 times.

320.title: Gaganyaan, ISRO's 1st human space mission delayed due to COVID: Govt
320.article_body: Gaganyaan, India's first-ever human spaceflight mission by ISRO, scheduled to be launched in 2022, has been delayed due to COVID-19 pandemic, said Jitendra Singh, the Minister of State (Independent Charge) Science and Technology.  "COVID-19 pandemic had a toll on the training of astronauts in Russia as well as India," he said. The mission is anticipated to be launched by 2024.

321.title: Minor girl abducted by 2 men, sedated & gang-raped in Hyd; accused held
321.article_body: Two men have been arrested by Hyderabad's Dabeerpura Police after they allegedly kidnapped, sedated and gang-raped a 14-year-old girl at a hotel. "The...[accused] were arrested and a car was recovered from their possession, they have been remanded to judicial custody," ACP Prasad Rao said. The arrests were made after the girl's mother filed a complaint with the police.

322.title: Kyrgyzstan, Tajikistan report ‘heavy weapon’ use in border clash
322.article_body: Kyrgyzstan and Tajikistan on Friday accused each other of deploying heavy weaponry like mortars and tanks in an escalating conflict over a disputed mountainous frontier area that broke out two days ago. At least three people have been reportedly killed in the conflict so far. Leaders of both countries are currently attending a regional security summit in Uzbekistan.

323.title: Hansal uses Arbaaz's pic as he shares post on Federer's retirement, Twitter users react
323.article_body: Filmmaker Hansal Mehta shared a post after Roger Federer announced his retirement. He shared Arbaaz Khan's photo and wrote, "Going to miss you champion. #RogerFederer." "Best tweet on Federer's retirement," a Twitter user commented while another joked, "Hopefully you won't miss Federer's acting." Previously, social media users had pointed out resemblances in the appearance of Federer and Arbaaz.

324.title: 5-time IPL champions Mumbai Indians appoint Mark Boucher as head coach
324.article_body: Five-time IPL champions Mumbai Indians (MI) have appointed former South Africa wicketkeeper Mark Boucher as their head coach. Boucher, who has been South Africa's head coach since 2019, will quit the national role after the T20 World Cup 2022. Earlier, MI promoted Mahela Jayawardene and Zaheer Khan to global roles in the franchise.

325.title: India A squad for one-day series against New Zealand A announced, Samson named captain
325.article_body: The BCCI on Friday announced the India A squad for the upcoming one-day series against New Zealand A. Sanju Samson has been named captain of the squad. The squad includes Prithvi Shaw, Ruturaj Gaikwad, Rahul Tripathi, Kuldeep Yadav, Rahul Chahar, Shardul Thakur and Umran Malik. The three-match series will begin on September 22.

326.title: Samantha to play princess, Ayushmann a vampire in a horror-comedy: Reports
326.article_body: Actors Ayushmann Khurrana and Samantha Ruth Prabhu have reportedly teamed up for a horror-comedy film. According to reports, Samantha will play the role of a princess while Ayushmann will star as a vampire in the upcoming film, which will be backed by Dinesh Vijan's Maddock Films, the production house behind films like 'Stree', 'Roohi' and the upcoming 'Bhediya'.

327.title: India undoing ecological wrong by bringing back cheetahs: Union Minister
327.article_body: Union Environment Minister Bhupender Yadav on Friday said India is one of those countries that believe in undoing ecological wrongs. "Cheetahs became extinct in India due to overhunting. We have decided to bring the large carnivore back. This ecological wrong is being undone," Yadav added. Notably, eight cheetahs from Namibia will be introduced in India on September 17.

328.title: 90,000 people treated in 1 day for water-borne diseases in flood-hit Pak
328.article_body: Tens of thousands of people are suffering from infectious and water-borne diseases in flood-hit Pakistan, government data showed. More than 90,000 people were treated on Thursday in the Sindh province alone, one of the areas worst affected by flooding. The unprecedented floods have killed 1,508 people, including 536 children, in Pakistan, the country's National Disaster Management Authority said.

329.title: Kerala HC stays transfer of judge over 'sexually provocative dress' remark
329.article_body: Kerala HC stayed the transfer of Kozhikode sessions judge who had made "sexually provocative dress" remark. The judge had made the remark while granting anticipatory bail to social activist Civic Chandran in a sexual harassment case. He had said that the offence under Section 354A of IPC is not prima facie attracted if the woman is wearing "sexually provocative dresses".

330.title: Vijay is aggressive; Prabhas, Jr NTR are humble: RGV on 'Liger' failure
330.article_body: Speaking about the failure of 'Liger', filmmaker Ram Gopal Varma said that actor Vijay Deverakonda is "naturally aggressive" but the film flopped due to Karan Johar's association with it. "Another factor...is humility...The down-to-earth nature of [Jr NTR, Ram Charan and Prabhas] impressed the Hindi audience...Then Vijay came along with his natural aggressive speeches at 'Liger' events," he added.

331.title: Blackmailed using video, 14-yr-old girl raped by many at Gurugram spa
331.article_body: A 14-year-old girl was allegedly raped by several men at a Gurugram spa where she got a receptionist's job. She said that on her first day at the job, the spa operator forced her into a room where a man raped her. She alleged the operator blackmailed her using the incident's video, after which she was raped on multiple occasions.

332.title: 5 held in Thane for cheating e-commerce websites of ₹5.85 lakh
332.article_body: The Thane Police arrested five persons, including an MTech engineer and a call centre employee, for allegedly cheating Amazon and Flipkart of ₹5.85 lakh by submitting fake Aadhaar card details. The accused cheated the e-commerce retailers by placing orders for electronic gadgets and later returning the parcels filled with sand and old clothes instead of the actual products, police said.

333.title: Sidhu Moosewala's father hospitalised after complaining of uneasiness
333.article_body: Late singer Sidhu Moosewala's father Balkaur Singh has been admitted to a hospital in Punjab's Patiala. Balkaur Singh had complained of uneasiness on Thursday night following which he was admitted to the hospital. Member of Parliament Preneet Kaur and former Aam Aadmi Party leader Dharamvir Gandhi visited him at the hospital.

334.title: Interstate drug peddler held in Hyderabad; 550 kg marijuana seized
334.article_body: Hyderabad's Rachakonda Police arrested a 36-year-old interstate drug peddler, identified as Venkatesh, and seized 550 kg marijuana from him. The police also seized a vehicle and two mobile phones from the accused. One of the accused, Vijay Prasad, allegedly asked Venkatesh, a taxi driver, to transport the contraband to Maharashtra and offered him a sum of ₹1.5 lakh per trip.

335.title: Sensex falls nearly 1,100 points, Nifty ends below 17,600
335.article_body: The benchmark indices ended in the red on Friday with the Sensex falling 1,093.22 points to 58,840.79. The Nifty ended 346.60 points lower at 17,530.80. Most sectors, including auto, IT, metal, banks and realty stocks plunged. Tech Mahindra, Infosys and M&M were among the top losers on the exchanges. Nifty Midcap 100 and Smallcap 100 fell in range of 2.5%-3%.

336.title: Sonal Chauhan fractures foot, completes 'The Ghost' action sequence
336.article_body: Actress Sonal Chauhan recently fractured her foot during MMA training for her film 'The Ghost' and was advised to avoid any training or action scenes for six weeks. The actress completed shooting an action sequence for the film despite her injury. A picture of Sonal with her foot in the plaster is going viral on social media.

337.title: 'Chup: Revenge of the Artist' was wrapped in 45 days: Sunny Deol
337.article_body: Actor Sunny Deol has stated that his upcoming film 'Chup: Revenge of the Artist' was shot within 45 days by director R Balki. "He is really a great professional with a great vision. He knows what he wants and is very precise with his work," Sunny added. The film also features Dulquer Salmaan, Shreya Dhanwanthary and Pooja Bhatt.

338.title: Wife finds out her husband was a woman 8 years after marriage in Gujarat; FIR filed
338.article_body: A woman in Gujarat's Vadodara approached the police against her husband of eight years after learning that he has allegedly undergone gender affirmation surgery. The woman said the accused went to Kolkata in 2020 for surgery to implant male organs in his body under the false pretext of undergoing minor surgery. An FIR has been registered in the case.

339.title: KGF 2 created history, saved Kannada film industry: Mahesh Manjrekar
339.article_body: Actor-filmmaker Mahesh Manjrekar has stated that Yash-starrer 'K.G.F: Chapter 2' saved the Kannada film industry which seemed like "it would shut down anytime". "But there was one person who believed in making a film and spending a lot of money on it. That person made a film named KGF and it created history," Mahesh said.

340.title: 3 arrested after encounter with police in Ghaziabad
340.article_body: Three men were arrested by Ghaziabad Police on Friday following an encounter in the Loni border area, police informed. Firearms and stolen property were recovered from them, police added. One of the accused was reportedly shot in the leg while a fourth one managed to escape. The encounter occurred after the accused tried to evade a routine check, police said.

341.title: Haryana Police to expedite training of 5,000 officers amid rise in cybercrime
341.article_body: The crime branch of Haryana Police has decided to speed up online training of over 5,000 willing policemen and officers in cybercrime investigation. The move has been initiated so that police can cope with rising number of cybercrimes in the state. Notably, 36,996 cybercrime complaints were received by state police till August this year, Haryana ADGP (Crime) OP Singh said.

342.title: 100 families in dark after supply cut in Noida society over power theft by builder
342.article_body: At least 100 families in Noida's Hilston Urbtech Society have been living in total blackout for four days after the electricity supply was snapped following allegations of power theft against the builder. The builder had reportedly taken a temporary connection of 50kW during construction. He didn't take a permanent connection later and continued to supply 750kW power from same line.

343.title: Mother asks Delhi HC to let 16-yr-old daughter terminate pregnancy
343.article_body: A woman has approached the Delhi High Court seeking permission to terminate the pregnancy of her 16-year-old daughter. The minor girl is over 17 weeks pregnant as per the ultrasound scan. The pregnancy is said to have resulted from a consensual and close relationship. The petitioner's lawyer said the girl is not physically and mentally prepared to raise a child.

344.title: BTech aspirant leaves home in Pune as father forces him to study medicine
344.article_body: A 17-year-old youth ran away from home in Pune and went missing on Tuesday, following an argument with his father over studies and phone usage. He was found at his uncle's house in Dighi. An engineering aspirant, the boy told police he left home as he wanted to pursue computer science, but his father was forcing him to study medicine.

345.title: House collapses in Delhi's Johripur Extension; 6 rescued, 2 trapped
345.article_body: A house collapsed in Johripur Extension in Northeast Delhi on Friday afternoon, Delhi Fire Service (DFS) said. "So far, six persons have been rescued...it is suspected that two more are there," DFS chief Atul Garg added. The rescue work is underway, he added. A video of the incident purportedly shows the house collapsing inwards while the walls remain intact.

346.title: Emma Thompson calls Shabana 'simply wonderful', latter shares message
346.article_body: Actress Shabana Azmi took to Instagram on Friday to share a message sent by Hollywood actress Emma Thompson. The message read, "My darling, I just saw the film and you are simply wonderful in it and it is absolutely fantastic...Sending you all my love." The two will be seen together in Shekhar Kapur's 'What's Love Got to Do with It?'

347.title: 4 dead in separate incidents of wall collapse in UP's Unnao
347.article_body: Four people, including two children, died in separate incidents of wall collapse in Uttar Pradesh's Unnao, officials said on Friday. Of the deceased, three are members of the same family who died when the wall of their house collapsed due to overnight rainfall. State CM Yogi Adityanath has announced ₹4 lakh financial assistance to each of the deceased's families.

348.title: Mumbai Police bust interstate gang of car thieves; 7 arrested
