348.article_body: The Mumbai Police arrested seven members of an interstate gang of car thieves and seized five cars worth at least ₹59 lakh. The accused used to change the number plates of cars involved in accidents with the number plates of robbed vehicles before selling them across Maharashtra. The racket was busted after a 25-year-old car dealer registered an FIR.

349.title: CEO compares Uber prices in B'luru to flight ticket from B'luru-Mumbai, people react
349.article_body: The Ken CEO Rohin Dharmakumar recently criticised high prices of Uber ride to Bengaluru airport. "A 1 hour Uber to Bengaluru airport costs 60-130% the price of a 1.5 hour flight to Mumbai," he tweeted. "Use Indian railways airport link train and shuttle bus," a comment read while another person joked, "It could...take longer to...[reach]...Bengaluru airport than flying to Mumbai."

350.title: Munawar dismisses breakup rumours with Nazila, shares video of her
350.article_body: Comedian Munawar Faruqui on Thursday took to Instagram Stories to dismiss rumours of his breakup with social media influencer Nazila. He can be seen focusing the camera on Nazila and saying, "Yeh kya phook k kar rahe hai ye log? Kya phook rahe hai ye log kya malum (What are people smoking and doing? I don't know)."

351.title: Suppression of local languages led to Hyd's annexation: Freedom fighter
351.article_body: A 94-year-old freedom fighter on Friday stated that the suppression of local languages like Telugu, Marathi and Kannada by Nizam rulers triggered a movement that led to the annexation of Hyderabad into India. Bhagwanrao Deshpande recalled that Urdu was imposed as the medium of education. Apart from language, issues like employment imbalance and culture were also raised, he added.

352.title: Amit Shah to arrive in Hyd today for 'Liberation Day' celebrations
352.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah is set to arrive in Hyderabad today (Friday) to take part in the 'Hyderabad Liberation Day' celebrations of the central government. The minister will unfurl the national flag at the Parade Ground and kick off the celebrations on Saturday. In another event, Shah will distribute equipment to specially-abled people to celebrate PM Narendra Modi's birthday.

353.title: ₹3 cr raised for US teen ordered to pay family of her rapist who was killed by her
353.article_body: An online fundraiser for a US teenager, who was ordered to pay $150,000 (around ₹1.2 crore) to the family of her rapist as restitution for killing him, has raised $442,000 (around ₹3.5 crore). The 17-year-old Iowa resident was trafficked at 15. She was allegedly drugged and assaulted by a 37-year-old man in 2020, following which she killed him.

354.title: 'Brahmastra' crosses ₹200-cr mark in India, earns over ₹300 cr worldwide
354.article_body: Director Ayan Mukerji's 'Brahmastra' crossed the ₹300-crore mark at the global box office at the end of its first week. Meanwhile, the film has grossed over ₹200 crore at domestic box office. Sharing a video revealing box office figures of the film, producer Karan Johar tweeted, "Love and light ruling...global box office...Entering the second week with a heart full of...excitement!!"

355.title: He was the epitome of a champion: Evert on Federer's retirement
355.article_body: After 20-time Grand Slam champion Roger Federer announced his retirement, ex-world number one Chris Evert tweeted, "He was the epitome of a champion; class, grace, humility, beloved by everyone." She added, "He elegantly mastered the sport like no other...Good luck to you, Federer don't go too far!" The 41-year-old Swiss will retire after next week's Laver Cup.

356.title: Putin thanks China's Xi for his 'balanced position' on Ukraine
356.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin on Thursday thanked Chinese leader Xi Jinping for his "balanced position" on the Ukrainian crisis. This was the first face-to-face meeting between the two leaders since Russia launched its "special military operation" in Ukraine in February. Putin also told Xi that Moscow backs Beijing's "One China" policy and opposes "provocations" by the US in Taiwan Strait.

357.title: Fiji PM's son charged with domestic violence in Australia
357.article_body: The son of Fijian Prime Minister Frank Bainimarama has been charged with a series of domestic violence offences in Australia. Ratu Meli Bainimarama is facing 17 charges, including stalking, assault and choking without consent. The offences allegedly took place in Sydney between February and May 2022, but the 36-year-old was arrested last week. He has been granted bail.

358.title: Saudi man marries 53 times in 43 years, says 'Was looking for peace of mind, stability'
358.article_body: A Saudi man has claimed to have married 53 times in 43 years, saying he was "looking for peace of mind and stability". The 63-year-old man told Saudi-owned television MBC that he is now married to one woman and does not plan to remarry. Abu Abdullah said he had also married foreigners during his overseas business trips.

359.title: Can't keep scaring people like this with ED, CBI: Kejriwal to BJP
359.article_body: Reacting to the sting operation claims by the BJP, Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal said that the government can't keep scaring people like this with ED and CBI. "Earlier, one BJP leader claimed it was fraud worth ₹1.5 lakh crore...Delhi's total budget is ₹70,000 crore. How can the scam be worth that amount?," said Kejriwal.

360.title: Woman jumps into well with her 2 children in Chhattisgarh, all die
360.article_body: A 23-year-old woman allegedly died by suicide by jumping into a well along with her two children in Chhattisgarh's Korba district on Thursday morning. Girja had left the house when all other family members were asleep, police said. A search was subsequently launched following which bodies of Girja, her two-year-old daughter and six-month-old son were found floating in the well.

361.title: When SRK threw Shilpa off balcony in 'Baazigar', audience screamed: Makers
361.article_body: Director duo Abbas Mustan recalled watching their film 'Baazigar' in a theatre and said that when Shah Rukh Khan's character threw Shilpa Shetty's character off the balcony, the audience screamed. "When he walks off from the crime scene, people started clapping, whistling. We did not expect this kind of reaction. The reaction was, 'This man is a superstar'," they added.

362.title: US' Warburg in talks to buy $150 million stake in Vistaar: Report
362.article_body: US private equity firm Warburg Pincus LLC is in advanced talks with Bengaluru-based small-business lender Vistaar Finance to acquire 30% stake in the company, Reuters reported citing sources. Warburg is reportedly looking to spend around $150 million to buy the stake. According to the report, the deal will value Vistaar at roughly $450 million.

363.title: Sushant Singh Rajput was murdered: Aamir Khan's brother Faissal
363.article_body: Actor Aamir Khan's brother Faissal Khan has stated in an interview that late actor Sushant Singh Rajput was murdered. "When the case will open or not, only time will tell. There are many agencies involved," he added. Faissal further said that the investigation is going on. "I pray that the truth comes out so that everyone knows," he said.

364.title: Massive fire at skyscraper in China; video surfaces
364.article_body: A massive fire broke out at a skyscraper in the central Chinese city of Changsha, according to state media. Video of the fire surfaced on social media with state media saying that the number of casualties was "currently unknown". "Thick smoke is spewing from the site, and several dozen floors are burning ferociously," state broadcaster CCTV added.

365.title: I'm glad 'Jogi' is a digital release, it will reach a wider audience: Diljit
365.article_body: Actor-singer Diljit Dosanjh has stated that he is glad that his film 'Jogi' is a digital release since it will reach a wider audience. Diljit attended the OTT launch of 'Jogi' virtually. The Ali Abbas Zafar directorial is based on the 1984 Sikh riots which began after the assassination of former Prime Minister Indira Gandhi.

366.title: Tencent fires nearly all staff of its gaming firm Fanbyte: Reports
366.article_body: Tencent has reportedly fired nearly all employees of its online gaming publication Fanbyte. The company's editor-in-chief, head of media and several writers were among those who were fired, according to a tweet by a remaining employee. As per TechCrunch, Fanbyte's Instagram profile was accessed by fired social media manager, who changed its display name to 'forgot the keys?'

367.title: CBI, ED troubling everyone, still don't understand scam in liquor policy: Kejriwal
367.article_body: Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal on Friday alleged Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) and Enforcement Directorate (ED) were "unnecessarily troubling everyone", but he still didn't understand what the liquor scam was all about. "One of their (BJP) leaders says it's a scam of ₹8,000 crore...LG says it's...₹144 crore and CBI FIR says there's a scam of ₹1 crore," Kejriwal said.

368.title: 4th year IIT Madras student from Odisha found dead in hostel room
368.article_body: A 21-year-old IIT Madras student from Odisha was found dead in his hostel room in a suspected suicide case on Thursday. The fourth-year aerospace engineering student, Subhranshu Sarkar, had backlogs and was reportedly stressed about it, said police. The parents of the deceased were called. The police are conducting an inquiry, while the body was sent for post-mortem.

369.title: Germany takes control of Russian oil giant Rosneft's subsidiary
369.article_body: Germany's Federal Network Agency has taken control of Russian oil firm Rosneft's subsidiary in Germany, the Economy Ministry said, adding the move would counter the "threat to the security of energy supply". The agency will control Rosneft Deutschland GmbH and RN Refining & Marketing GmbH and its shares in three refineries. Rosneft accounts for 12% of Germany's oil processing capacity.

370.title: Design studio behind Coke, PVR partners with Masters' Union for UX course
370.article_body: Masters’ Union has launched a 6-month User Experience Design part-time program in collaboration with Onething Design, a design studio which has worked with Coca Cola, PVR and Noise. Taught by UX designers, the program aims to help students bag UI/UX jobs by building a portfolio, working on real client projects, paid internships at Onething Design and over 20+ placement drives.

371.title: Harshal can't bowl yorkers, leaks runs when he bowls seam-up: Sarandeep
371.article_body: Ex-Team India selector Sarandeep Singh said Team India pacer Harshal Patel cannot bowl bouncers or yorkers. "Every time he...[bowls seam-up], he gets hit for runs," added Sarandeep. Discussing Team India's squad for T20 World Cup 2022, Sarandeep stated, "Mohammad Shami shouldn't have gone out...What he can do with the new ball, I don't think any other bowler can."

372.title: Jacqueline called Sukesh 'man of her dreams', wanted to marry him: Reports
372.article_body: Actress Jacqueline Fernandez was so convinced and influenced by Sukesh Chandrasekhar that she would call him the "man of her dreams" and was thinking of marrying him, ANI reported while quoting sources. Special Commissioner of Police, EOW, Ravindra Yadav said, "There is more trouble for Jacqueline as she did not cut ties with Sukesh even after knowing his criminal antecedents."

373.title: Very shocking: Akram on Shahid Afridi saying Shaheen had to spend own money for rehab
373.article_body: Reacting to Shahid Afridi saying that Shaheen Afridi had to spend his own money for his injury rehab and Pakistan Cricket Board didn't do anything for the fast bowler, Wasim Akram said, "This is very shocking." He added, "If it's true...then it's wrong on PCB's part. He should have straightaway been sent to the best knee surgeon in the world."

374.title: Congress urges KCR to reinstall Ambedkar's statue in Hyderabad's Panjagutta
374.article_body: Congress leader V Hanumantha Rao hailed Telangana CM KCR for naming the new Secretariat after BR Ambedkar and urged him to reinstall his statue which was earlier removed in 2019 in Panjagutta, Hyderabad. "You are doing a good job by naming the Secretariat after Ambedkar and appealing to the Centre to name the new Parliament after his name," said Rao.

375.title: IndusInd Bank shares gain 4% on reappointment of Kathpalia as CEO
375.article_body: Shares of IndusInd Bank gained nearly 4% intraday on Friday following the news of the reappointment of Sumant Kathpalia as the Managing Director and CEO for another three years. Its stock was trading 2% higher at ₹1,219.80 apiece on NSE at 2 pm. Kathpalia was first made the MD and CEO of the private lender in March 2020.

376.title: Former Punjab CM Captain Amarinder Singh to join BJP next week
376.article_body: Former two-time Punjab CM Captain Amarinder Singh and Punjab Lok Congress (PLC) chief will join BJP next week, the party spokesperson confirmed on Friday. PLC will also reportedly merge with BJP on September 19. Singh will join BJP in the presence of party president JP Nadda and other leaders in Delhi. Singh formed PLC in 2021 after quitting Congress.

377.title: Glad India is one of the fastest growing economies: PM at SCO Summit
377.article_body: PM Narendra Modi while speaking at Shanghai Cooperation Organisation (SCO) Summit in Uzbekistan's Samarkand, said that India's economy is expected to grow at the rate of 7.5% this year. "I'm glad that ours is one of the fastest growing economies among the largest economies of the world," he added. Furthermore, he said, "We are focusing on people-centric development model."

378.title: 2 police officers stabbed in area just minutes away from where the Queen's coffin is placed
378.article_body: Two police officers were stabbed by a man on Friday in a London area that is just minutes away from where the Queen's coffin has been placed. Police said that the incident, which took place near Leicester Square, is not being treated as terror-related. "Enquiries into the circumstances surrounding the incident are ongoing," police added.

379.title: Higher rate hikes could risk global recession in 2023: World Bank
379.article_body: World Bank has warned that with central banks simultaneously hiking interest rates, the economy could go towards a global recession. With US, China and the Euro-area economies slowing, even a "moderate hit to the global economy...could tip it into recession", it said. The global core inflation rate could stay at about 5% in 2023, nearly double the five-year pre-COVID-19 average.

380.title: I am the best Batman, Ben Affleck got nothing on me: George Clooney
380.article_body: Actor George Clooney said during a recent appearance that people look at him and think 'Oh, he's just the best Batman'. The actor further said that actor Ben Affleck is "the best available" Batman. "Really though, Ben Affleck, really? He's got nothing on me!" George added. Other actors who have portrayed Batman include Michael Keaton, Val Kilmer and Christian Bale.

381.title: US announces new $600 million arms package for Ukraine
381.article_body: The US on Thursday announced a new $600 million arms package to help the Ukrainian military battle Russia. The package includes High Mobility Artillery Rocket Systems (HIMARS), Claymore mines, 105mm artillery rounds and 155mm precision-guided artillery rounds, the Pentagon said. Since Russia invaded Ukraine in February, the US has provided more than $15 billion in military assistance to Ukraine.

382.title: We'd say 'Get Rohit, Kohli out, half of Team India's finished': Asghar Afghan
382.article_body: Discussing his team's approach while playing against Team India, ex-Afghanistan captain Asghar Afghan said, "Our plan used to be around Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli." "We'd say 'Get them out, half of Team India's finished'...We used to believe...if we get...them out early, then...100-120 runs would be less from India's total in an ODI and...60-70 runs in a T20I," added Afghan.

383.title: Musk accuses Twitter of data security failures in amended lawsuit
383.article_body: Elon Musk has amended his lawsuit against Twitter to include allegations made against the platform by whistleblower Peiter Zatko. The amended lawsuit accused Twitter of fraud for concealing serious data security flaws in the social media company. The "newest revelations make undeniably clear" that Musk has "the full right to walk away" from $44 billion Twitter buyout deal, it stated.

384.title: 'RRR' became word-of-mouth hit in West, never expected it: Rajamouli
384.article_body: Filmmaker SS Rajamouli has stated that his film 'RRR' became a word-of-mouth hit in the West, adding that he never expected the film to do so well with Western audiences. "I thought the sensibilities are different...I am still trying to understand, to be very frank," he added. Rajamouli had appeared for a chat at the ongoing Toronto International Film Festival.

385.title: WB tops in 100 days work for which Centre not releasing funds: Mamata
385.article_body: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee criticised the central government for 'not releasing' funds for 100 days work and other schemes implemented in the state. "Bengal tops the 100 days work scheme for which the central government is not releasing...money," Mamata said. She further criticised BJP and CPI(M) leaders for creating obstacles in the implementation of the 'Deocha Pachami' mining project.

386.title: We were tiger & leopard state, will now be cheetah state: MP CM
386.article_body: A day before eight cheetahs will arrive in India, Madhya Pradesh CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan said it would be the biggest event for wildlife in this decade and a dream come true. "We were a tiger state, leopard state and now becoming a cheetah state," he said. We prepared the Kuno National Park for this 20 years ago, he added.

387.title: Sensex crashes 1,050 points, Nifty below 17,600 dragged by IT, auto stocks
387.article_body: The benchmark indices declined in the afternoon trade on Friday, dragged by IT, automobiles and metal stocks. The Sensex crashed by 1,050 points to 58,882, whereas the Nifty fell below 17,600, down 327 points at 17,550. All sectoral indices were trading in the red in the afternoon, with the IT, auto and metal indices shedding more than 2% each.

388.title: Fumbled on first shot while shooting with SRK for 'Brahmāstra': Mouni Roy
388.article_body: Actress Mouni Roy has revealed that she had "an out-of-body experience" while shooting with actor Shah Rukh Khan for 'Brahmāstra'. "The first day I was going to shoot with SRK, some ADs came to the room and said, 'Please be well prepared' and memorise all your lines'...I went on set and fumbled on the first word," the actress said.

389.title: Woman, her daughter insult judiciary in a court in Mumbai; booked
389.article_body: Mumbai Police have booked an 80-year-old woman and her 52-year-old daughter after they allegedly interrupted a judicial proceeding and insulted the judiciary in Girgaon court. The duo was upset about the next date granted by an additional metropolitan magistrate, the police said. A judicial clerk said, "The screaming was so loud that the staffers of another court...asked about the shouting."

390.title: Dunzo agent runs behind moving train to deliver package to passenger; video goes viral
390.article_body: A video of a Dunzo agent running behind a moving train to deliver a package to a passenger standing at the train's door is going viral online. The customer can be seen celebrating after successfully receiving the package. Social media users compared the incident with Dilwale Dulhania Le Jayenge's climax scene, with a user saying, "DDLJ 2 leaked scene."

391.title: Manforce Condoms maker Mankind Pharma files draft papers for IPO
391.article_body: Mankind Pharma, the drug maker known for Manforce Condoms and Prega News brands, has filed draft papers for an IPO with SEBI. The offer only comprises an offer-for-sale portion of 4 crore equity shares by existing shareholders and promoters. Mankind reportedly plans to raise at least $700 million in one of the biggest IPOs ever attempted by a pharma company.

392.title: Lucknow administration issues advisory after wall collapse due to heavy rainfall kills 9
392.article_body: Uttar Pradesh's Lucknow district administration on Friday issued an advisory after a wall collapse in Dilkusha area due to heavy rainfall killed nine persons. "All government, non-government and private schools will remain closed today," the administration said. It has advised people to not leave their houses until it is "indispensable". This comes amid an alert of more rainfall till Saturday.

393.title: US will cross red line if it sends longer-range missiles to Ukraine: Russia
393.article_body: Russia's Foreign Ministry has said that the US would cross a "red line" and become "a party to the conflict" if it sends longer-range missiles to Ukraine. Moscow "reserves the right to defend its territory", it added. The US has already provided Ukraine with advanced GMLRS rockets fired from HIMARS launchers, which can hit targets up to 80 km away.

394.title: Hydrogen peroxide leaks from truck carrying containers in Pune
394.article_body: Pune Metropolitan Region Development Authority's fire brigade responded to a leak of hydrogen peroxide from a truck which was carrying containers of the chemical on a highway in Shindewadi on Friday. The leak possibly occurred due to pressure from the containers kept above, a fire officer said. "We used water sprays to dilute...leaked chemical as per...guidelines," the fire officer added.

395.title: Bihar Police arrests all 4 accused in Begusarai firing case
395.article_body: Bihar Police has arrested all four accused in the Begusarai firing case. The accused persons have been identified as Keshav, Sumit, Yuvraj and Arjun. The firing incident led to the death of one person and at least nine others were injured. The bike-borne assailants had opened fire on random people at multiple locations in Begusarai.

396.title: TN tells HC it won't return leased elephants including Joymala to Assam
396.article_body: After Assam government filed a PIL, Tamil Nadu government told Madras High Court that it won't return the leased elephants, including Joymala, to Assam government. This comes following allegations that Joymala was being tortured at a temple in Tamil Nadu. Earlier, environment ministry shared a video of Joymala and supported Tamil Nadu government's claim that the elephant was doing well.

397.title: PM's plan to derail Bharat Jodo Yatra: Congress on ED summons to Shivakumar
397.article_body: After Karnataka Congress chief DK Shivakumar received summons from the Enforcement Directorate (ED), party leader Jairam Ramesh criticised PM Modi, alleging that it was part of his tactics to derail the Bharat Jodo Yatra. "But he (PM Modi) won't succeed," Jairam tweeted. "Such cowardly acts will strengthen our resolve to decimate the corrupt Bommai...government," Randeep Singh Surjewala said.

398.title: ED freezes ₹46 crore kept in payment gateway accounts in Chinese loan apps case
398.article_body: The ED has detected and frozen funds worth ₹46.67 crore kept in payment gateways Paytm, Easebuzz, Razorpay and Cashfree Payments after recent raids in the Chinese loan apps case. The agency had conducted searches at six premises in Delhi, Ghaziabad, Mumbai, Lucknow, Gaya under PMLA, 2002, on Wednesday. The investigation was conducted against app-based token named HPZ and related entities.

399.title: I know nothing about Brahmāstra 2, want Ayan to see where Junoon goes: Mouni
399.article_body: Actress Mouni Roy has stated that she wants 'Brahmāstra' director Ayan Mukerji to put his thought into where her character Junoon goes after the first film. She added that she knows nothing about part two. "Ayan [came to me on set and told] me to not forget my connection to Shiv ji and Junoon's devotion to Brahmadev," the actress said.

400.title: I don't know if I'm that graceful: Sara on playing Sharmila in her biopic
400.article_body: Actress Sara Ali Khan was recently asked if she could portray her grandmother veteran actress Sharmila Tagore in her biopic. She said, "She's so graceful. I don't know if I'm graceful...She's so well-read...such a classy lady and she's had such a life." The actress further said that she has spent more time talking to her about worldviews than her craft.

401.title: CMs of Assam and Mizoram to hold talks on Monday over border dispute
401.article_body: Chief Minister of Assam Himanta Biswa Sarma and his Mizoram counterpart Zoramthanga will hold the second round of talks in New Delhi on Monday to settle the border dispute between the two states. Mizoram shares a 164.6-km border with Assam and the dispute over it is linked to colonial demarcations in 1875 and 1933.

402.title: Teacher thrashes 14-yr-old student for asking to go to toilet in UP
402.article_body: A 14-year-old Dalit student was allegedly thrashed by a teacher for seeking permission to go to the toilet in Uttar Pradesh's Bijnor. According to police, the teacher denied the permission initially and when asked for the second time, he beat up the student with a stick, leaving him unconscious. The teacher was arrested and booked under the SC/ST Act.
